text: Sin City Smokers was smokin' hot!  I used the Amazing Master Chef Steve's sinfully phenominal BBQ for a company meeting and received an overwhelming "5-star/2-thumbs way up!" review from the men.  This crew is not easily satisfied, so a resounding "Well Done" to Steve, his staff and Sin City Smokers.  You have created customers for life.

Whelp , went here with a family of five looking for a good barbecue spot. What we got was a whole lot of fat, skimpy meat with marginal flavor that's terribly overpriced. Wanted a sample of different meats like most places have; they don't offer any. Everything is al la carte. Menu says $2 for sides then they show you that the $2 price is literally a tablespoon so you'll need to pay $6.99 for a pint or $11.99 for a quart of one side. No mashed potatoes, very limited selection. Ordered their "Bad ass fries" and received these plain ass fries with nothing as advertised (picture). I ordered to go so I didn't check my food until I made it home and was pissed. Underwhelming and disappointed is an understatement.  My nine year old summed it up best with " Dad, I don't really taste much meat so I'm just dipping it in the sauce". My thoughts exactly. Severely Overpriced. Don't waste you time nor money. I would've glad shelled out more elsewhere. This puny portion set me back $70! Never again

I was in the area and looked on yelp for some lunch ideas. So happy I chose this place today. The place was super cute inside, and very clean. I ordered the pork sandwhich, which came with coleslaw, I also ordered the baked beans, and a big red soda. The pork was super tender and smokey tasting. The baked beans were SO good. It had chuncks of smoked thick cut bacon, very delicious. Also the coleslaw was like none Ive ever eaten before. It didnt have a ton of vinegar..it had alot of fresh dill and tasted very light, I could eat a whole bowl of it, just by itself. The prices were very reasonable and affordable, along with the portions. I highly recommend this restaurant! Great spot.

My husband was told by a friend to check this place out, so we decided to try it.  First off I'll say, we're a bit picky when it comes to restaurants.  However, this super cute and quaint restaurant was very clean, so were the restrooms-a HUGE plus in our book!  Secondly, the owner Steve, is a BBQ champion, he has more trophies on display in the restaurant than you can shake a stick at.

We split the 'Big Daddy', (because we wanted to taste a little of everything), which is five smoked meats, 2 sides and Texas bread. OMG, the food was incredible and the sauces are to die for!  We had to restrain ourselves from eating it all and ended up bringing the leftovers home for dinner.

We're so happy we made the trip across town, it was definitely worth it!!  If you're looking for outstanding bbq/smoked food, look no further.

As a connoisseur of fine BBQ you can understand why initially I was skeptical about using Sin City Smokers. After they came and set up for the party of 30+ people I still was a little concern. Steve was outstanding. The brisket was the best I ever had. The BBQ and the Chicken was outstanding. The people at the party were so impressed that they all asked for Sin City Smokers brochure. These guys are amazing. The questions that should be asked. Would you hire them again for any future parties? The answer is absolutely yes without question!!!!!!
Best barbecue in Las Vegas! Definitely need to try the Texas Melt and the Bad Ass Fries!! Highly recommend stopping by! The owners treat you like family and the food is so fresh and yummy.
Found this place on Yelp. Very good BBQ. Definitely gonna come back. Brisket sandwich and pork sandwich had a great smoky flavor. The fried okra also worth a try.

I am unfortunately getting to this review a little bit later than I would have liked. Sin City Smokers catered my wedding which took place at an outdoor location back in April. 

First: Picking our food and our setting was incredibly easy and affordable. 

Second: they came fully prepared with all the necessary equipment, and tableware making the set up incredibly easy on us. The serving went off with out any problems whatsoever.

Third: (and most important) the food is excellent. The portions were great. The beef brisket was so popular, we had none left over. The sides were also great, especially the Mac N Cheese! We found that the portioning was almost spot on. We had just enough left over to enjoy. 

Special thanks to Christie for helping with all of this and making it work out great.

We hired Christie and her staff for our wedding.  She was in constant communication with us even through opening a new restaurant.  Her decor was great and our guests could not stop boasting about how great the food was.  We couldn't of asked for a better catering service!
WOW!! great BBQ very very friendly people and did I say great barbecue wow good barbecue. brisket is amazing ribs are nice and meaty

Having lived here for almost 15 years,
I didn't think I could ever find BBQ like I had back home. Until today. This place was phenomenal! I had the pork sandwich with the smack-a-roni mac n cheese and it was damn tasty!! It was this place or Lucille's and so glad we chose THIS place!! Highly recommend and definitely a new place in our rotation.

Went there after having their food at a catered event.  The food at the event was very good and very flavorful.  So I was excited to go and eat there, usually in restaurants the food is way better than catered.  We went for dinner, was very surprised to find that you only get 4 ribs with the pork ribs, and the size of the sides were ridiculous.  The sides were not much bigger than the little cups that you get your salad dressing in at most places!  I had the brisket, it was ok at best!  Odd to have raw onions with it..... No texas toast or anything else, just 3 pieces of meat and to very small sides.  So dinner for two, rib meal, brisket meal, 2 sodas, and tip it was over $40 dollars.  Most likely wont be back, staff was alright, the one seemed new which is not a problem.  But as far as quality for value.......very poor.

I used Sin City Smokers for a last min catering company for a party we where getting ready to host,and boy did they knock it out of the park. Not only was the communication on point,but the food was amazing! I would highly recommend using them for any events you have coming up!  Thanks Steve and crew for your awesome service!

Holy Mother of God....!!!! This place ROCKS. With a Motto of "If you can smell the Wood, you know that it's Good"...this is now my "go to" for BBQ.  Me and my guy were in yesterday...looking for a Pulled Pork sandwich and these guys killed it! Succulent smoked pork, piled high between Texas Toast with an awesome slaw. The Perfect Bite, every time. Family owned place means they put the Love into every order.  Thank you Felicia for being so helpful and awesome. Your customer service is top notch. The food is So Good!!! So good that I am sending my guy back (Right Now :) ) to get their Thursday Smackaroni Special....(and back on Friday for the Babybacks.  Thank you Sin City.

Worst BBQ I have ever had.  Wife and I were not impressed at all.  With all their awards that the restaurant displays - couldn't see how they could have won any.  Ribs I had were full of fat and when I complained - the server was like "oh well".
This barbecue place is awesome.  The food was excellent, atmosphere great and staff was so accommodating!  We will definitely be back, my mouth is watering just thinking about it!

Sin City Smokers BBQ is probably the best BBQ I have ever eaten. The menu has something for everyone, the staff was attentive and very friendly, and the food was awesome. The facility is very clean, music is outstanding and ambiance is very welcoming. If I could rate 10 stars I would. 
My wife had the brisket sandwich with sides of five cheese smack-a-roni and baked beans. WOW! The adventurous type that I am dined on the brisket quesadilla. OMG! The iced tea is fresh and the portions are H U G E. Enjoy!

Best BBQ in town! Finally a place where everything meets my expectations. Everything was tender and flavorful. The mac n cheese was amazing. And many people will agree my mom makes the best baked beans...till I tasted theirs! My only complaint or two is that they don't make collard greens AND they only serve the burnt ends in dishes and not as a choice of meat.

This place is a true gem. I had a hankering for barbecue and asked a friend where I should go. He said check out the new place Sin City Smokers. I am so glad I went. I had the rib sandwich with spicy barbecue sauce and a side of potato salad. They chopped my ribs and placed them between two pieces of Texas Toast. Literally one of the best barbecue places I've been in quite some time. The owner, Steve, was very nice and is always there. I'm a BBQ Catering Owner and very picky about BBQ. Trust me, this place is great! Thanks Steve!

Ordered food for Father's Day. Full rack of ribs, chicken, brisket, mac & cheese, dill coleslaw, beans, and French fries. Everything was amazing. I ate so much my stomach hurt, but managed to save some leftovers for today. Looking forward to those later! I wish Sin City Smokers lots of success as I will be back very soon, and often. 

Sorry, no pics - we were hungry!

Sin City Smokers catered our recent team event of 40 people. I cannot stress strongly enough how great Steve, Christie and the whole SCS team were to work with. First and foremost, the food was absolutely outstanding. Everyone on our team was raving about how delicious all of the food was. Many commented that it was the best BBQ they've ever had. Second, SCS did a fantastic job serving the food to our team in a friendly and professional way. On the day of the event, the setup, service and clean up was attentive, thorough and without issue. Finally, SCS were extremely professional before, during and after the event. We are completely satisfied with SCS and won't hesitate to cater with them for another event. I will recommend them to anyone who is interested.

We came by today which is a Friday so I had the baby back special. My wife and friend both got the BBQ chicken. Far as the meats, my ribs were good but not $15 good and they both felt the portion on the chicken was lacking, along the anything special on taste for the price. The sides were small too. Use to normally getting loaded at BBQ joints with sides or at least bread but here not the case. Only drink options are in a fridge or lemonade/tea is prepared. Have to say, if you do go by, have to try their banana pudding! Now that was delish! Overall for Spending $50 for 3 people to eat, I'm disappointed. Had high hopes for this place based on help reviews but maybe we came on an off day or time. 
Also, not family friendly at all. Well those with small children. I have a almost two year old, yet no high chairs were seen nor ever offered so it forced my wife to have to hang onto him. Active little boy! Also no changing tables in bathroom. All in all, try it out for yourself. I've had better for less/more but probably not the worse spot I've ate BBQ at lol
Sin City Smokers makes the most amazing BBQ! The steaks and ribs were seasoned and cooked perfectly! Steve and Shirley were also super cool. Highly recommended!

Best Barbecue in Las Vegas period. The last place I had amazing brisket was in Texas for my friends wedding. At first I thought the side I got with my plate of meat was small but honestly after eating the brisket I could barely finish the side I got with it. The people at their restaurant are friendly, and everything on the menu is something I want to try in the future. Definitely going to be coming back here more often.
Great place to eat, Mac n Cheese is delicious! Have a great variety of foods to choose from.

Really good food! Amazing quality. The Chef Steve really only seems to care about making good BBQ. The smoked meats have smokey flavor all the way through.  The slices of brisket are thick and satisfying. The burnt ends are the largest and juiciest I've ever had. The sandwiches are unique and have a perfect balance of flavors. There are three BBQ sauces; none are super spicy but all taste good.  The price is right too! My friends like me really like the cheap giant salads. For dessert lovers they have a selection if rotating desserts that are tasty too.  Service is great too, everyone is super friendly. Definitely recommended

Bottom-line:  AMAZING BBQ!  The cashier staff are friendly and super helpful!  There are some interesting twists on how you can enjoy your awesome BBQ (plate, salad, quesadilla, etc).  Atmosphere reminds me of some our favorite BBQ places we used to frequent when we lived back in the South.  Two thumbs up!
First time here and it definitely wont be my last.  The food is amazing and everyone is really friendly. Great BBQ spot!!

Not a super "fancy" place, but delicious food. We will definitely be back!

It's definitely a chill place to go with friends for a quick bite. We had the Texas Melt, smoked pork, and brisket with Mac and cheese, fries, and maple bacon sweet baked beans which were delicious. Pork sandwich was my favorite, but ask for extra bbq on the side!

As others mentioned, it's served in an aluminum tray (which I don't mind) and is really convenient if you have leftovers.
I lived in Henderson for 17 years and Sin City Smokers BBQ is the best Smoked BBQ in the Las Vegas Valley! OUTSTANDING!!!!

We ordered a pound of brisket and a pound of pulled pork for a gathering at the house and we were all blown away. Hands down the best BBQ in town. Do yourself a favor and check this place out. Prices are reasonable and portions are great.

I really wanted to like this place. They are close by and they did are licensed unlike the bbq trailer set up in the lot next door. But this place is bad. First there was no air conditioning in dining area. The food is totally a la carte. Doesnt see bad at first but the total was high for a place like this. Brisket just the meat $9 I asked for it chopped and what I received seemed to be the pile left at end of chopping board. Black, fatty greasy mess. Couldn't even eat it. The sides at $2 each are limited and the creativity to the beans and potato salad did not pay off. They also come in little cups smaller than a Snack pac pudding. Very stingy for inexpensive items. Sauce was either spicy or too sweet. I asked for bread because it is not listed anywhere but it was nothing special. For two of us it came to $34.95.  Only one other customer and service was very slow. The girl serving us had long brown hair flying around with no net or hair the the health department requires. BBQ is limited in town but I will be driving out to the Texas joint on St Rose Parkway from now on. Too bad this area really needs good restaurants.
Always a delight when i come in. Staff is great,food is outstanding. Highly recommend for foodies and families from all over to try high quality bar b que.

Sin City Smokers, Chef Steve and his crew were great for our 120 person Holiday Party. The menu was wonderful: carved prime rib, smoked turkey, seasonal veggies, scalloped cheesy potatoes, yams with pecans,  stuffing, gravy, gelatin and green salad, rolls and butter, a feast of quantity and taste! All the food was flavorful,  served with a smile, and cleaned up thoroughly and promptly.  We would recommend Sin City Smokers, Chef Steve and his crew for your event and I'm certain we will hire them again for another community party.

After a month or so of exploring the menu, this BBQ is legit. I feel like the brisket just keeps getting better!

The daily specials are refreshing additions to the typical choose your BBQ meat offerings.  I especially enjoyed the tamales, stuffed baked potato and the Friday babybacks! The creamy dill slaw is my favorite side hands down followed closely by the almost dessert baked beans.

We come here nearly weekly now sometimes even twice a week since we work across the street.  It's great having Steve & his team in the neighborhood! Keep up the solid work!

Come check this place out if you haven't...we want to keep em around!

Again, another barbecue place with mediocre, dried out meat. Worse yet, it was so expensive. I got the three meats. It was in a small aluminum bowl with a tiny, tiny side of macaroni, which was watery. The meat portions were small. Nothing else came with it. The brisket wasn't so dry, but that's because half of it was fat on both pieces. All of this for a whopping $20. I won't be back.

Having competed against the owner, Steve, at a couple local rib cook-offs, I was anxious to try his new place out.  I am glad I did.  A large group of us, about 25 or so, met up there and filled the place up.  His staff handled the sudden rush like pros.

The food was as good as I has heard it was.  My wife had the brisket and it was flavorful and tender.  I had one of their sandwiches, the Whole Hog, it was fantastic with plenty of meat on it.

The sides, I had the Smac and Cheese which was wonderful, and my wife had some fries. were on the small side for the price, $2.00. It would be nice if he had some combo plates set up, but that's not a deal breaker. 

All in all it was a great visit and I would return if I happened to be in that part of town.  Maybe Steve will open one near me...

Pros... nice restaurant, front end lady was extremely helpful.
Cons... very pricey for what you get (portions) and the BBQ wasn't spectacular... but will probably go back for a lunch special... one visit isn't enough to make a life-long decision!

I rarely write a poor review, but this business was an exception.  I went based on the reviews in Yelp.  I ordered the special of the day which was a base of mac and cheese, with pieces of "burnt ends" of beef brisket.  It was then supposed to be covered with more mac and cheese and fried jalapenos.  

It  arrived in a tin foil take out bowl (even though I was eating in) accompanied by a plastic fork and knife.  The mac and cheese was lukewarm, with a not more than 5 small pieces of meat on top if it.  The mac and cheese was only OK, but the meat was terrible.  Burnt ends (at least in Texas) are meaty and juicy.  Here half of the meat was just fat, and the other half was dried out and incredibly tough to eat.  There were a few small (less than 5) small pieces of jalapeno.

The waiter came over to ask how the meal was.  It told him it was terrible.  The meat was dried out with little flavor.  In virtually every other restaurant when I tell someone that I don't like a dish, they immediately offer to replace it with another dish and often offer to refund my money.  Here at Sin City, he simply stared at me when I told him how bad I thought the food was, and offered me nothing.  I then got up and left.

Unfortunately a very poor experience all around.

I used Sin City Smokers for my outdoor park wedding. My entire experience was nothing short of amazing! If I could give them more than 5 stars I would! They served some of the best bbq I have EVER had! Their smackaroni and cheese is out of this world good!!! My guests were talking about how good food was for weeks afterwards.  Their customer service and attention to detail far exceeded all of my expectations!

My family and I went there the other day because we had heard so many positive things about the place.  

First off the staff is friendly and very helpful. Spot on there. However the food was dry and bland.  Also I didn't understand the raw onions and peppers.  Not something that I was expecting. 

I really wanted this place to be good but I was disappointed.

Crap! I cant believe I haven't let everyone on here know how good this place is! Ive eaten here a lot and called in to go orders.     If there is better bbq in Vegas I have not found it. I love bbq! 

I get the bad ass fries with sausage and it is easily 2 meals. 2 awesome meals!! 

The staff is always friendly. 

No BS I just got hungry writing this. 

Ive brought a few people here and they have always left saying how good it was. I know they were telling the truth and not just saying that because they've all gone back on their own.  

The biggest problem I have with this place is its between my house and the gym. So tempting every day going to and leaving the gym. I wont lie sometimes this places beats the gym.
Quaint "hole-in-the-wall" restaurant with excellent food and service. My only complaint was the plastic utensils.
Some of the best Brisket and BBQ I've ever had. Really glad I stopped by here tonight. The service and friendliness of the staff made the night.

I was really excited to try this place out. It's a cute place and staff was friendly. The brisket was the worst I've had, it was fatty, mushy and had zero smoke flavor. Brisket should not be a pile of mush. The beans were incredibly sweet with no mustard to balance...just sweet, sickening sweet. The mac & cheese was completely tasteless, it literally had zero flavor. I couldn't eat my food, it was really just bad. As I left I passed two men who I assumed were owners, they didn't even acknowledge me or ask how it was. I give this place 6 months before they go out of business.
SUCKS!  $20 And I leave still hungry,   3 slices of brisket and 5 slices of sausage and a very small cup of collard greens full of liquid.  I should have known why the place was empty.

I am not a bbq fan but let me tell you eating here has changed my ways. It was absolutely AMAZING! The service and staff was excellent. The food was even better. Fresh and good taste. You can tell everything was made fresh!!

All I can say is wow. Very good and worth every penny. First "hog back" I've had since moving from East Tennessee. Every bit as good. Thanks guys, we'll be back. Our first and dfinitely not our last. The staff was friendly, the order was accurate and the food was delicious for a fair value

Hired for an outdoor party and they were really great! Showed up on time and set up everything! All my guests and the birthday boy loved the food. They do everything and give you one less thing to worry about! Very reasonably priced and worth every penny!

Stopped in for lunch. Most BBQ places in Henderson/Las Vegas seem to be closed on a Sunday, but these guys were open. Nice, clean place. Had the two meat combo (pork ribs/brisket). Both meats were tender, juicy and favorable.  They do serve beer and wine, so no BYO. I would very much recommend.

Me and my family came here because we saw the announcement on the Vegas Weekly Magazine, which pictured the restaurant as the best BBQ place in town.

Here is my experience: we got there, the menu is on the wall, we had to order everything before we can seat. There's a paper towel roll on the table that you can't move, when the food comes, the only utensils they had to eat the BBQ are plastic and the food is served in "to go" containers. The dressing salads aren't as good as they should. Everything is À La Carte.

The meat was good, is the only reason why I put 3 stars, everything is terrible which should be reviewed by the owners and have it on their consideration.

I thing for the price we paid for the dinner, it's like a high-end restaurant for the price but eating at a fast food restaurant for the service. Do you imagine eating BBQ, Steak with a PLASTIC fork and knife??? We don't. 

Not very happy at all, but at least we tried.

Sin City Smokers catered my wedding reception at an outdoor picninc site at Mt. Charleston Nevada.  As a teacher, our budget was tight so full-meal catering was not something I thought I could afford.  After stumbling upon Sin City Smokers searching the internet, I immediately recognized the awards they had accumulated, and sent the owner Steve a casual inquiry.  
He called within the day and helped me plan a delicious menu that fit within my budget.  I was able to offer my guest a full meal of the most amazing American BBQ I've ever tasted for a fraction of the cost of a"typical" catering company.  Steve and his crew were professional, generous and served the most amazing food I've ever had at a wedding....luckily it was mine! 
I highly recommend Sin City Smokers and will myself be looking to hire them again.  They perfected our reception and made the whole experience of working with them a pleasure!
Yum!  This is our new BBQ place.  We ordered pork ribs, chicken, brisket, salad, and onion rings.  Meat was tender and flavorful.  Love it!

Thank the BBQ Gods for blessing us with this amazing place. Sin City BBQ is my new favorite spot. Seriously came home and told everyone I saw about this place! 

We went on a Friday, and the Friday deal was Baby Back Ribs. We got the platter with 5 meats and 2 sides! They threw in some of the baby back ribs (so we actually got 6 meats ). We checked in with Yelp and got a third side too! Don't judge our fatness. 

They have side specials, so we decided on the buffalo fried cauliflower, with menu sides of Mac n' Cheese and Potato Salad! GET THE POTATO SALAD, you will not regret it.
This place always tastes so good no matter what day you come and I really like there tamales too. If you haven't tried this place yet I would venture out and try some good old BBQ.

Was very happy. Steve and team were awesome when I walked in and told them what I like and what I needed. Appreciate that he walked me through his smoking process. 

Brisket was on point.  Fatty and lean were both good. Tender and great bark. 

Mac and cheese with the Cheezits were solid.  Glad he adds a little crunch

Beans were amazing.  Great consistency and flavor

Service was real good.  Team was engaged with me. 

Banana pudding with real solid but the pb&j pudding was one of the best desserts I've had in a long time.

My first visit here after being recomended by a coworker. I'm doing a specialized diet and can't eat carbs so I just got lbs of the hot links & brisket. Great flavor and not too expensive. Lots of BBQ joints popping up in Henderson but this place seems ahead of the pack!
Super cute place, friendly staff, and some serious bbq! So glad I found this on Yelp and stopped in for a quick lunch. We will be back!
Tasty food and good prices.  Won lots of awards and several great BBQers like it too.
Really good brisket. I like going to local BBQ places versus franchised places.  The price is really good for what you get.
It was delicious, some of the best brisket I have had and easily top 3 in Vegas. I will be coming back, although on take out orders you can plate it a little bit better other than that it was great.

Wow just wow, good quality! The meat is amazing! Ribs are incredible! Brisket and mac a Roni and chees is marvelous! I will be back! A must!  Brittney is incredibly nice and a fantastic server!! Must eat here, it is a hidden Gem!

Staff was very friendly on arrival. Placed order and food came pretty quick.  Very good BBQ flavor in the sandwich and the Mac and cheese like is said. Wow.   Will definitely be back to try something else.
This place has a fantastic atmosphere, very friendly staff. The food was delicious and portions were big. Will definitely be back.

This was my first time here but my experience was great. When you walk in they have a display of all their awards for their great bbq. The place was Clean, staff was nice and helpful , music they were playing was great and best of all the bbq was awesome. I had their specialty Texas melt with their mac n cheese. One of the best brisket sandwiches I've had and their mac and cheese was really good too. The mac and cheese wasn't a huge portion but the sandwich was enough so it worked itself out. I will be back here again for sure.

What's the phrase?
Fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice, shame on you.
I always try something at least twice, I believe everyone deserves a fair chance. 

This place was a one star experience on BOTH visits. First was a lackluster dine in experience where a sandwich consisted of white toast, a small scoop of meat (of which half was fat and gristle), and FAKE American sliced cheese straight out of the Kraft wrapper. Sitting next to that is a huge pile of sliced raw onion (why??) and a gigantic "pickled jalapeño" (which is NOT pickled whatsoever, just likely boiled down with no vinegar or spices and is bitter and inedible). Out of this plate of food I ate maybe 3 fork bites of meat. No joke, that's the edible part. Of a full sandwich.

Second visit was tonight's carry out for the family which is as $35 of the coldest, fat soaked food I've ever eaten. And don't think it was cold because we showed up late. We live right around the corner and from our phone call to pickup it was 10 minutes max. Cold chicken quarter platter...so cold my kids asked why it was from a fridge. Cold and wilted "side order" fries, maybe 10 total, might I add. Smoked pork tacos that literally tasted like they had ladled the pork fat right on top to make them moist. With every bite, my mouth was coated with cold, flavorless pork fat. I actually gagged and spat it out and ate the corn salad topping for dinner. My husband also said his sandwich had no sauce but was covered in the same fat drenching, making it a soggy mess and flavorless.

Listen, if you've made it this far, don't go there. It's gross, not just disappointing, but gross. Not sure what the deal is with place, but I have no idea how they own and operate a "restaurant". I hate to add in the rude commentary, but at this point I am angry these people have taken any of my money with the terrible product they've provided me.

Had lunch here with a customer of mine. Food was so good I had them cater two parties I had upcoming. Brisket is to die for. Great bark, juicy, wonderful smoke, and incredibly tender. Sausage was tasty and I loved the sauces. 

Service was great in store and catering service was outstanding, friendly, timely, and everything with a smile. They are my go to caterer now in Las Vegas and my favorite BBQ house in the area. Worth the drive to Henderson.
They recently catered an event and it was amazing. If you love good BBQ, this is the place to go. I highly recommend it.

I had to walk out because I don't understand their system. They have servers or a waitress staff of some sort,  but they aren't helpful. My 1st and only visit some cook or chef had to come out of the kitchen to greet at the counter after I was standing there for 5 minutes. I got too much info too fast and was handed a paper take out looking menu. I asked the waitress or cashier that was at the counter I I can take time to go over this menu,  she said sure have a seat she'll take care of me.  I sat at a table for 30 minutes confused by this menu and I had questions but no-one came to my table. A couple walked in sat down behind my table ordered and was served  in 15 minutes while I was still sitting after 39 minutes.  So I walked out. I don't know how the food tastes but that's the worst service I've ever experienced in a dine in restaurant in my life.

We used Sin City to cater a company party with 100+ employees and they did a fantastic job. I was not on site but worked with them to coordinate everything. On the day of the event they called to confirm, arrived on time, served while they were there and everyone loved the food. I would recommend them and use them again.

I liked the potato salad, the beans were a little sweet. But the ribs didn't do much for me. Since I've been cooking mine sous vide I don't really expect to find anything better. I think for most people this will be a good place. I only tried the ribs.

This is the best Texas bbq in all of the valley. This is real Texas bbq. Not like the "other" places that claim to be Texas bbq. This is the real deal. The owner, Steve is a pleasure to talk to. The brisket is awesome. We can't wait to return for a little taste of home.
Fail in love with the mac and cheese today!!! BBQ was amazing. If you are a BBQ lover you'll love SCSB

Love the brisket! I'm a brisket connisour and It has the most perfect smokiness and had a  melt in your mouth texture...MMMM! The coleslaw is delecious, it has a tangy dill and celery hit to it..can't want to try the rest of the menu.

Make sure you get a side of the maple bacon baked beans, they are great.  Brisket and ribs are yummy too.  It's a bit hard to find, there is no sign, so you have to look at the glass in front of the shop to locate it.

My husband and I went here last weekend for the first time. The food was delicious and I was so happy that they had a vegetarian option also. My husband got the brisket sandwich and said it was the best meat ever... It was fall apart tender. Basically, you choose your meat type, choose how you'd like it (tacos, sandwich, etc), and then you can choose a side if you want. The mac and cheese (smack-aroni) was amazing. They also have a ton of sauces to choose from. The decor is unique and we liked the funny signs up all over. The staff was so friendly, what you'd for at a small family-owned business. The only suggestion: It was $6 for a can of local microbrew beer, but we would have also been happy if there were cans of cheaper beer at a lower price (under $5) or pints from a tap if we're paying $6.

I gave this place another shot and am happy I did.  Good food good people good deal. 
This isn't Austin barbeque but but was good. Juicy brisket, sauce still wasn't anything to write home about, and the spicy one was too spicy for me.
Crazy Mac and cheese made with a few different types of cheese. It had cheez-its in it which gave it a cool texture but I don't like cheez-its. So it won't be my choice next time. I would like it if they had a veggie side dish 
They even had a veggie selection for my vegetarian friend! Who said the veggie quesadilla was amazing! 
I'm going back Wednesday for their baked potato special. $9 and sounds pretty good!

Sin City Smokers has the best BBQ I've tasted. They make great macaroni dishes and all their meats from the Pork Ribs to the BBQ Brisket is unmatched in flavor. The environment is great, the staff couldn't be more personable, and the smell of the grill will make you wish the food got there faster than it already does

Sin City Smokers sold me once my conversation with Christie began. She is an enthusiast extraordinaire, bright, cheery and on top of all of our needs and concerns. Her comforting assurance that my father's Celebration of Life would go smoothly, that they would feed all who attended, and could even stay later than planned to help out with any hungry stragglers if necessary, helped alleviate some of our stresses and brought buoyancy to the heavy situation at hand. After phoning my sister to let her know I'd found our caterer, she suggested a few changes to my menu choices. Without problem or hesitation, tweaks to the originally planned menu were made, and from burgers to chicken to German potato salad and grilled fresh, seasonal vegetables, all of the food was delicious. They supplied all the necessities: plates, utensils, napkins, condiments, and I was assured, too, they would clean up and vanquish all remnants of their presence, that we wouldn't even know they had been there, and true to their word, it was so. They did, however, leave all the excellent, leftover food - another blessing in a time of deep grief. Christie was there serving up kindness and smiles along with the spread, and griller Matt was amiable and skilled; they made the event all the more relaxed and cordial.

Thank you, Sin City Smokers,  for your excellent food and service and helping to make our dad's celebration a great success!

I'm always down to try new BBQ spots and usually leave disappointed. I didn't leave Sin City Smoker's disappointed, but I left wanting more. I had the Ribs and Brisket, Mac n Cheese, and the Baked beans. Ribs were good, the brisket was good, the Mac n Cheese was good, the Baked Beans were good, but nothing was Great. The sauces were one dimensional in flavor and the rub they used didn't really complement the meat. There are some BBQ places that when you take a bite it tastes special and I'm just waiting to find that in Las Vegas. This place was good and I'd be down to go back, but if I'm shelling out $ for BBQ I'm holding out for awesome or amazing BBQ not just good BBQ which is what Sin City Smokers is. 

Also, the sides were too small. Like abnormally small. Especially considering the sides are a la cart to the meats and are ~ $2 each. The size of the side would have been ok had it been included with the meal but to pay for essentially 2 bites of Mac and cheese is a little silly.

I was looking for good bbq for my wedding reception. Steve completely surpassed my expectations! He made this Bride incredibly happy:) From the beginning to end he made everything so easy for me. We all know wedding planning is stressful, but knowing no matter what we'd have good food gave me piece of mind! 

Now on to the food:
The beef Brisket was to die for! I've honestly never had better. Such good flavor in the crust and very tender. Even the fatty parts were like butter. Mmmmmmmmm

The hot links, macaroni & cheese & Bourbon baked beans were a huge hit! Trust me! With my new family being from Louisiana they know their bbq and I can say everyone left happy!:)

I was even surprised when we got to take some leftovers back with us. They came so well prepared to handle my forever changing guest count lol I cant say how much we loved Steve and his Sin City Smoker crew. Thank you for making my wedding reception an amazing experience!
New to Vegas but love this hole in the wall bbq place is legit. awesome staff amazing sauce! Any of the sandwiches sre good but I'm going back for the loaded fries
Delicious.. whole hog is an awesome sandwich! Will do again.. Mac and cheese so good.
Food was so good can't wait to try everything. Wonderful atmosphere staff so helpful and a pleasure to talk to. I'm so glad they are so close.
This place is SO DARN GOOD! Best Mac N Cheese in town "Hands Down!" The food is amazing! I've been to plenty of BBQ in town. Roadkill better watch out!

I have three words for the food here, legit legit legit!! I had the brisket plate with two sides, the smack & cheese and the beans, I also added a half pound of the smoked pork. First off the brisket was insane good, moist, fall apart with a great tasting bark. The pork was also great, more of a Carolina chopped style but still tasted fabulous. The beans are sweet which I like, they definitely don't taste like your typical Q place beans and I like that. Smack and cheese was good, it had crunched up cheeze it's on top and was really creamy. I am glad that a real Q joint has opened up near my house because I will definitely be a long time customer!

This was, hands down the BEST brisket I've ever tasted--flavorful and juicy and tender. Also had the ribs which were very good also. The mac and cheese and dill coleslaw were very good, but my favorite side was actually the baked beans. Really sweet and that's the way I like them. We'll be back--In fact we almost went back the very next day.

Great job guys!! I never had your barbecue before,  and it was awesome. You catered lunch for us today at work. Big portions, great taste.  And you provided plates,  and silverware. I hope we use you again.

Really great first experience at this little joint. The food was fantastic and really a good bargain for what you get. The sandwiches are huge. The only suggestion I would have is that the teas and lemonades where fresh and possibly made in house. By the taste it just seemed like they were from a package. The service was great and for only being open a month the crew knew the menu and had suggestions for us. Will definitely be coming back!
To die for BBQ. Friendly staff, great prices I honestly live for this place.

First off...everything was spot on.

Before you order: after perusing the menu on the wall, be sure to take a glance down below the register...posted on the front of the bar/counter are three other menu items not listed with the others. One being the Big Daddy Platter for $25: five meats, two sides, two Texas toast.

Two of us shared 2 ribs (nice and lean, wonderfully tender), 4 brisket slices (also trimmed, nice and lean), sausage (hot links? tasty and flavorful), chicken, and pulled pork (not fatty, moist and yummy), beans and fries.  

I decided to add the Special that day; BBQ Lasagna for $7. I know it sounds weird, but was amazingly addictive. It was definitely different, but we couldn't stop taking bites of it. I would call it a BBQ Casserole, though. :)

After throwing on a couple pieces of cornbread to boot, we stuffed ourselves silly, and still had more than half of almost everything to take home.

Everyone was super friendly and it felt very homey to eat in there. The decorations were eclectic and charming, including a quite full trophy case and oversized check from a competition won.

Unfortunately, we didn't see the desserts in the case until after we were done...or had any room for by that time...but we will make a point to try a couple the next time, because we will definitely be back!
Great food! Great service! I will definitely be back soon. The staff clearly has a passion for excellence and it shows in both the food and the overall hospitality.

I've been to every bbq place in town, and this place takes the cake. 

I've done ribs, brisket and a sandwich from them and they are all great. The sauce is great, the meat is tender and juicy, and the fat is not too over the top.

You smell the smoke wood when you first enter the restaurant, but the aroma doesn't overpower your meal.

Staff is friendly and willing to go over the menu, the restaurant is clean and cozy.

My only suggestion would be to increase portion size on the sides. $2 is a little steep for one scoop of mac and cheese or potato salad.

Came here cos I was craving ribs and they had great reviews on here. What a let down. The ribs were subpar at best. Mac and cheese was bland, corn bread was the best thing I tried. Really disappointed cos I was excited to try it out.

We had Sin City Smokers Barbecue cater our family holiday dinner, it was incredible!!! The food was great: finger licking ribs, the most tender juicy smoked turkey ever and delicious sides. The service was excellent. Steve was very professional and easy to communicate with.  
Thank you very much, Steve!!!!

I went to Sin City Smokers for lunch yesterday. It wasn't the best BBQ I've had in Las Vegas, but it wasn't horrible. 

The staff was very friendly, smiles all around. It seemed to be that they had some regular customers in the restaurant when I was there. 

Food: I ordered the rib plate and added 2 sides (cole slaw and beans) and a water. $21 for lunch. A little pricey, but I gave it a shot. Ribs were St. Louis cut, 4 bones and garnish of onion and a jalapeño were included. The bones weren't cut through and I was unable to cut them with my plastic knife; the kitchen had to cut them through for me. Ribs were OK, a bit fatty. The sides tasted great, but it was a SMALL portion for what you paid ($2 each). 

Will I go back again, probably. But I'll try something else next time.
Come from a BBQ family in Iowa. Was looking for some BBQ on lunch from in da cut barber shop came in service was nice vibe was cool food was cool too. Kelsey

First time eating here tonight. We are from the southeast and accustom to great barbecue. This was truly a great experience! The flavor of all the meats and sides was top notch. The portions were fantastic. Plus they have good sweet tea!!!! 

Inside was clean and the staff was extremely friendly!

Definitely coming back.....soon!

Amazing food! Impeccable service! Felt the love! Our wedding reception was a HIT and the guests couldn't stop eating hahaha! Stop looking now and call Sin City Smokers! They will exceed your expectations, they did for us.

Thank you guys so much for helping to make our wedding reception absolutely perfect!

Chelsea and Ryan Perreira

Sin City Smokers catered our company Holiday Party in early December at Pole Position and did a great job all around. Christie and her team were a pleasure to work with and the food was extremely popular with our  employees. We had the Smoked Baby Back Ribs, Santa Fe Style Chicken with Au Gratin Potatoes and a Medley of Grilled Squash and Vegetables, followed by dessert of Lemon Squares. I would definitely recommend their services for any of your catering needs.

I ate here with my boyfriend yesterday and the food was great and affordable! We had the sausage and the beef brisket, both were wonderful. This will probably be my go-to for BBQ from now on. I also really like the atmosphere... I mean, it's casual, but it's well decorated and I enjoyed looking around at all the stuff on the walls.
Simply put, my clients were thrilled. Sin City catered an event for me and I  as told by numerous guests that it was the best BBQ they've had. What more can you ask for?

Was in the neighborhood, had not had a bite to eat since breakfast, so dropped in.

Ordered the brisket with a side of bbq beans. Nice smoke flavor to the meat, nicely seasoned. Moist. Beans were nice, but order is on the small side. 

Ordered this as their "sandwich" method of serving, so it came on two pieces of Texas toast and a side of "appropriate slaw". The slaw was a horseradish slaw and was out of this world! This needs to be added to the sides menu! I'd order this all day everyday!

Will be back for the pork-a-strami, which per the pit master, is a brined and smoked pork loin which is finished on the flat-top, ala east-coast beef pastrami.

Food is really good.  Some things are quite overpriced.... we were charged $7.99 for a plain cheese quesadilla for a child.  Also, on Friday, they have a full rack special.  I asked if it had to be baby back ribs, and the dark-haired girl running the register told me I could get spare or baby back.... but failed to mention spare ribs was $9 MORE.  I get that they are bigger, but you should mention that there is a huge price difference, especially when I clearly asked about the special. I didn't get a very friendly vibe from her in general.

Best BBQ in Las Vegas.  I've been to the other ones, (I wont mention their names) and they don't compare.  The brisket is awesome.  The mac and cheese is the best and the corn bread is similar to my wife's.  My dad lived in Texas where he claims the best BBQ is from and he was very impressed too.  He also agreed that its the best in Vegas.  I will be going back soon!

Read about Sin City Smokers in the Las Vegas Weekly this week & had to try it out. My friend Steve came with me & we both agree this is our new regular BBQ spot! Had the porkstar for lunch which is a pulled pork Mac & cheese sandwich. So good!!! I was full after the 1st half, but it's so delicious I ate the whole thing. With daily & weekly specials to try. I will be coming back for a long time to come. The staff was also friendly.

Yum!! The two of us ordered the big daddy sampler platter and a couple extra sides. Everything we had was incredible. The ribs were fall-off-the-bone. The brisket was so tender. We loved the sides just as much as the meat: dill coleslaw, jalapeño potato salad, mac and cheese and beans. So good!

First time trying Sin City Smoke and it was delicious. The sauce was amazing and the brisket was cooked perfectly. Other things of note was: I also really liked seeing the owner cooking in the back, not always possible but I always feel the food is better when the owner is at the helm. Also the decor was comfortable, clean and gave a good vibe.

This review is for the brisket alone. Growing up in The South, I've had all kinds of barbecue. Folks, I swear to you that I've never had a barbecue beef brisket like I've had at Sin City Smokers. It is the best brisket that has ever touched this mouth.

I have had this spot in my radar for quite a while, finally gave it a go. Upon entry to this spot, I liked the down home feel and decor of the place. Reminds me of a few small town BBQ spots I've been to in CA & AZ. The gal upfront was very polite and cheerful, told her I was a newbie and was asking what her recommendation was. This spot has daily specials and everything looked good, so needed to narrow it down. The sandwich options looked awesome, was told that the porkstar would quench the beast in my belly. Glad I listened, it was an amazing grilled cheese and mac & cheese with chunks of chopped pork. As an added bonus, with a checkin on yelp you can get a free side. The shoestring fries were pretty good and loved the seasoning they came in. The sandwich was perfect and stuffed with piggy, mac n cheesy goodness. All in all was a really good small place to grab some great grub for a good price. Will definitely be back for more.

For those of you who don't want to read a detailed review:  GO GO GO...the food is friggin' ridiculously amazing!

And for those who want details:  The strip mall was deserted, it was late afternoon on a Sunday.  They looked closed due to the darkened windows but that was not the case.  Country music was playing, we were greeted immediately upon entering and asked if it was our first time in.  It was so they explained how the menu worked (super helpful!).

I ordered the brisket on Texas toast, baked beans and coleslaw with dill.  OMFG...
Brisket:  incredibly tender!  Our server recommended putting the barbecue sauce and the horseradish on the sandwich.  Being a foodie, I had to taste both the barbecue sauce and the horseradish prior to dressing my brisket.  OMFG once again!  The horseradish was not overpowering and had crunchy cabbage in it (it rocked!).  The barbecue sauce...wow...not sweet, acidic, secret recipe...I added them both as suggested.  Best idea ever!
Baked beans:  Sweet with maple coming through nice and strong with a subtle hint of bacon.  LOVED.  It could have been my dessert and I almost drank the sauce left over after the beans were gone.
Dill coleslaw:  Not too much mayonnaise (I hate mayonnaise!) and the flavor of dill came through although it was not overpowering (perfect and fresh tasting!).
Chicken:  Barbecued perfectly and sooooo tender!  The barbecue sauce on the chicken was different than the brisket sauce; sweet but not overpowering. 
Jalapeno potato salad:  Once again, not too much mayonnaise and the jalapeno did not burn your mouth in the slightest, it only added a special touch to what can be a common, boring side dish.  Oh how good it was!
Beverages:  Oh the options!  The mint tea (with fresh mint and unsweetened) was so refreshing!  The sweet tea was delicious too.  All brewed on site, none of that crap coming out of a soda machine dispenser!  Also saw a pitcher of cherry lime aid, you KNOW that has to be delish!
I'm coming back and dessert will be on the agenda as well as the food!
I'm a huge fan.  HUGE.

Sin city smokers catered our wedding on 4/14/18 and every guest was impressed, full, and asking where they could get this food regularly. Kennedy (I know I didn't spell that right) was our go to girl on our special day and she didn't disappoint, great job, girl! Christie was amazing with the prep leading up to our day and she was an absolute pro! We are so thankful we decided to spend a bit more than the chain bbq(not even that much more if I'm being honest) and get the best! Thank you to sin city smokers for an impressive, professional, and fully satisfying reception dinner!!

We came in to order some food to go for the fam.  I loved the feel of the restaurant.  There are tons of BBQ trophies and awards.  It really feels like a family spot.  The menu is cool you pick the meat (or veggie) you want and then how you want it, plated, sandwich, taco, fries, quesadilla, etc.  Since we were ordering for several of us we opted to order by the pound.  We ordered 1 rack of spare ribs, 1/4 lb brisket, 2 hot links (we were told 2 links = 1/2lb), veggie plate, quart of mac and cheese, quart of potato salad, 3 corn bread and a sweet tea.  Our total before tip was just under $100.  Price was around what we normally spend when getting bbq so that wasn't an issue.  Food was good.  It just didn't blow anyone away.   Didn't seem like we got 2 hotlinks but maybe it was a 1/2 lb and that is closest to 2 links.  Hot links were our favorite part of the meal.  I could have done without all the onions, peppers, jalapeno, etc, that in some form was on every meat.  It didn't affect the taste of the meat that I could tell.  It was more of a garnish.  Maybe it is a regional thing?  I think the hot links had more veggies than the veggie plate.  Mac and cheese was topped with Cheez-Its that was a nice touch.  The potato salad had jalapenos but wasn't spicy (that is not a complaint just fyi).  The cornbread was sweet and had great taste but was extremely dry.  Their house made bbq sauces were really good.  They have a regular and spicy.  They had several puddings in the drink case.  On the day we were there they had banana pudding, peanut butter and jelly (with nutter butters!) and a third I can't remember maybe funfetti or something like that.  When we got home we wished we would have gotten them.  

They have daily specials that look great red beans and rice, bbq tamales and what I am most looking forward to full rack of baby back ribs on Fridays.  I will def be back for that and hopefully update my review.

Immaculately clean and an awesome friendly and knowledgeable staff!! Now for the good stuff!! Brisket was off the chain!! Perfectly smokey, great salt and pepper flavor on the bark and the rest was beefy deliciousness!! Hot links were spicy but not over powering and had a solid texture not over cooked and sitting around all day like some places. Baby backs had the perfect competition style bite through and great flavor. My wife loved her whole hog sammich... sides were good, my wife loved the Mac and beans were too sweet for my taste. (But I didn't come here for sides).  This guy is the best kept bbq secret in Vegas and it won't be long before lines are out the door!!
First time visit. Excellent brisket sandwich. They served it with a very unique and yummy horseradish slaw. The best part; however, had to be the baked beans! Simply amazing!

The ribs were good, but putting ray onions with it seemed strange, plus a big pepper was odd.
took much too long to get the food.  How hard is it too get 4 ribs on a plate, which was a container only for an in house meal. Pretty sad.

First time visiting this place. Thought i would check it out after seeing them Instagram. Man did i make the right choice coming here! The ladies upfront were very helpful in making my visit a welcomed one. 

I got a plate with Brisket and Spare ribs with a side of their 5 cheese smack-a-roni. Wow was the plate very tasty brisket was spot on with its fat ratio and meat consistency. The ribs were great with their sweet sauce. The macaroni with the Cheezits caught me off guard but hey i love Cheezits!! 

Overall i will be coming back to check out the rest of the menu!!

Thought we would try a different place for lunch on a Thursday and decided on Sunday City Smokers Barbecue.  The location used to be a sushi bar, but you can tell the building inside and out has been remodeled.  Walking in you pass a very impressive wall of trophies!

I tried the Thursday special - St. Lewis short ribs and a side (I chose the shoestring fries).  Hey don't have a fountain soda machine, but have a good assortment of both cans and bottles (both Pepsi and Coke products) plus several other choices.

The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The seating area was clean, and the decorations are kinda fun.  The food tasted good.  Definitely worth trying again!

We tried this place because there is another BBQ just down the way.  You won't find BBQ beef ribs here. No drink with any combo or order. I ordered the brisket and chicken. The brisket was on point with flavor and juices. However the chicken I got was rubbery and under cooked. Hopefully things will be better on my next swing.
I really like their food. This was my second time in and it's very good. I can say that it's the best in the Henderson area!

This place was delicious! We happened to drive by and we glanced and saw "smokers"- we thought it could be bbq so we turned around and it was! The place is very cute and the staff was very friendly and helpful when it came to ordering takeout. I got the pork sandwich and my husband got the brisket sandwich.  We ordered mac n cheese for a side.  We ended up ordering some smoked wings too. Okay-- it was so yummy!  The wings are a must- between the smoky deliciousness and tenderness we ate them in about two seconds!  The Mac n cheese was super- they put Cheez Its on top!  Our sandwiches were awesome- the meat was tender and the bbq sauce was terrific.  They have a great dill coleslaw that was perfect on top of the sandwiches- great experience! We will be back. Normally we'd try and snap a pic but we ate everything to fast!

Let me start off by writing, that I absolutely love ribs. It is one of my top favorite foods. With that being written, I couldn't even finish half of one rib, it was that horrible. I'm just glad that I did not waste more money on a full rack.

Limited choice of potato salad is a bad start (with jalapeños). Only ONE side with a 2 meat plate is skimpy and forces you to buy another side. 

Meat was better than average. Brisket fell apart, but too much grizzle; links spicy, but amount of meat for a two meat plate was skimpy. NO bread served. 

$22 with a drink seems pricey. Got iced tea and shocked to find NO SWEETNER except sugar in a jar and there's only one jar for the entire restaurant.

On day I was there it was 89 outside and a/c was not on inside. 

Friendly helpful staff though. Funny how bbq places never seem to get it all quite right. 

Would not go out of my way to visit again but it's ok in a pinch if you're close by.
Perfect food. Bbq is awesome. The Gordon ramsey of bbq. I ate their beef Brisket last week and I'm still licking my fingers bro.
One of the best barbecue spots I've been to in vegas! Also, do yourself a favor and order the Mac n cheese....you're welcome.

Everything in my life could be summed up with "I should've gotten the fries" I should've, you should too. Or tacos, anything besides 1 meat and some onions and peppers because when they brought it out I was so sad, the menu said hot links as in plural - more than one but I'm pretty sure it was only one albeit a delicious hot link I was still really hungry. Someone ordered the fries and I wanted them because they're massive compared to my little one link and some onions... the sides left some stuff to be desired, their Mac n cheese wasn't anything to write home about and I took one bite and didn't eat any more, too dry for me and not enough cheese but to each their own. 

The staff was super friendly and attentive so if I do come back I'm getting the fries!

Sin City Smokers! I can't say enough good things about the food, the service, and the overall experience of working with this company. The new hubs and I decided to do it ourselves for our wedding over Memorial Day weekend. I contacted a bunch of places, as we weren't sure what kind of meal we wanted, but we knew our budget. Christie's reply was prompt and professional, we met shortly after for a tasting at their Henderson location. She gave us a number of options to fit our budget (120-150 wedding guests) which included service, entrees, sides, bread, and beverages on a per person basis. And the food!! - I took one bite of that juicy chicken, I wanted to slap my mama it was so good! 

The contract was clear and unambiguous. The couple of times I did have questions before the big day, Christie was responsive and helpful. 

The day of the wedding, they came in promptly and set up in the designated area. Service was flawless and everyone had more than enough to eat, with tons left over. As we surveyed the party, everyone was full and more than happy with the food. It was just what you want from a vendor on your wedding day - totally uneventful, professional, and polite - everything just worked!!! We (the tired bride and groom) feasted on the leftovers they thoughtfully packaged for us for the next couple of days. 

All in all, this was the best day of my life and Christie and her team helped to make that happen. Thanks Sin City Smokers, looking forward to booking you for our next event! (and stopping in for dinner next time we find ourselves in Henderson)

- Mr. and Mrs. BerryWhite

Not worth the money. We came in and ordered take out which came out to $91.00. The rack of ribs we got were already cut but didn't even resemble ribs all bones and cartilage and dried out. Would never go back. I should have known the place was empty.

Great BBQ. Reasonably priced and a friendly staff. Highly recommend for BBQ in Henderson. It's in a really deserted strip mall so you get great parking too. The meat just fell off the ribs and was so tender! Definitely will be going back regularly!

JUST WOW!!! I mean like it was my husband's Birthday, I had just finished making a Presentation to the staff at the One Stop at the Green Valley Library across the street from 'Sin City" and all of a sudden, after I finished presenting, I stopped and asked one of the attendees; "Do you know of a good place that serves B.B.Q? Without hesitation, I was told simply: "Sin City". Well, I just couldn't let my husband's Birthday pass without celebrating with some quality barbecue and that's JUST WHAT I FOUND at Sin City!!! The happy faces that greeted me as I placed my order was a welcome change to other eateries I'd been to in the area and then, my heart nearly "skipped a beat" when they brought out our orders of a rack of pork ribs, corn bread and creamy coleslaw!! Then I ate......That rack of ribs nearly had me up and dancing with delight!!! Very, very little fat on that rack and maximum flavor-ishous meat with two sauces to go along with it to boot!! The corn bread and creamy coleslaw did not disappoint either and were the perfect compliment to our ribs. The portion were also perfect too. Not too much and not too little either. The vibe of the place is "so bomb" too. You'll love the rustic, funky feel there too. THANK YOU SIN CITY FOR A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!! WE SHALL RETURN!!!!

A must try BBQ joint that serves up some legit BBQ with a twist...heard about their Thursday Special the Big Daddy Mac which is 5 cheese Smack-a-Roni, topped w/Burnt Ends, more cheese, and deep fried jalapeños...and I knew I had to go...I must admit it was Smack Daddy Delicious...although I couldn't even finish a quarter of it which was alright because it reheats nicely...I also tried a couple sides...jalapeño potato salad (nice and creamy with a little kick to it), maple bacon baked beans (tasted like pancakes), smack-a-roni (the topped cheese-its are awesome), corn bread (oh so moist)...I thought I already found the best BBQ in Vegas but now after trying Sin City Smokers I'm conflicted since I already can't wait to try their ribs, BBQ tamales, tacos, and bad ass fries.

This will be our go to bbq spot now. The brisket is so tender and juicy with great bark. The ribs are fall of the bone good, with a great smoky flavor. Both sauces they have are great but the meat has such a great taste you really don't need much sauce.

WOW was my first reaction after seeing the spread that Steve set-up and DELICIOUS was the reaction I experienced after tasting the food. I hired Sin City to cater a party of 12 and the guests were still talking about it days later. Steve showed up in time to set up a beautiful spread of 4 different types of meats and four sides and everything was hot, delicious and fresh.  Besides that, he was very friendly and responsive to my questions and changes. Can't recommend Sin City Smokers enough! :-)

Best BBQ in Vegas!!! Hands down! There's no competition. I've had most of the BBQ here in the Vegas valley and there's nothing like a hearty meal at Sin City Smokers. One of a kind, unique,  and original. The perfect place to enjoy with your family. The atmosphere is so positive and the customer service is phenomenal. And the food!!! My god! Is too damn good not to taste! The meat is perfect! Seriously! And the rest of the food compliments the meat so well. The flavors are addicting! Big hearty portions and good prices. Make it how you want or try the daily and weekly specials. And if you don't know what you want, you can't go wrong with their signature sandwiches. The best. Period.You haven't had BBQ till you have had Sin City Smokers!

Food was just ok. Service wasn't at any better.  This is actually the third time I've been here but after this visit I am not happy with this establishment.   It's overpriced and the Chef/Owner didn't feel the need to wear gloves while preparing my food.  The previous visits the owner/ chef had no problem grilling a jalapeño that is served with the food however in this occasion it seemed to be a problem to grill a jalapeño.   As the food arrived I noticed a barely grilled jalapeño.  While my husband got an ice cold jalapeño .   I wouldn't recommend this place.   Las Vegas has way more better Barbecue restaurants.  Don't waste your time here !

This is a nice little BBQ place that's kind of hidden. I ordered the Texas Melt and felt like the beef was a little dry, they do have their BBQ sauce that I smothered it in. Their fries are delicious, I'd definitely order a side of fries with your meal. Love the environment, very country themed with country music playing. The ladies at the front are super nice and friendly.

This place is so good I had to force myself to stop going there because I would not have enough money to pay my other bills. You walk in to a wall of trophies that they have one from various barbecue competitions. The smell intoxicates you as you walk toward the register. Everything I have ever ordered there has been the absolute best I have had of that particular type of meal. I never order chicken at a barbecue place - I feel it's a waste... until I tried the chicken here. My current favorite is the B.S.L.T.  That stands for bacon steak lettuce and tomato sandwich. It haunts my dreams. This is the kind of barbecue that would delay air force one on the tarmac while secret service picks up food and brings it back.  This is the kind of barbecue that would make cops and criminals forget their differences and just sit down at the table to eat. This is the kind of barbecue that would eliminate racial tensions across this land. This is not a paid review nor my connected in anyway to this establishment. Although if they were to pay me I absolutely would not take cash I would accept only brisket.
Our first time at this restaurant and the food was delicious, place was very clean, the owner greeted us, and the employees were very nice! Thank you for a nice experience!

great atmosphere awesome staff love how steve the owner is laid back but knows his sh@$!
i love his rendition of a texas style sauce for his cab brisket. i bought a quart! great prices and enough on each order for two people. plus his specials are great tamale tuesday i ate off one plate for two days and fed my wife too! 
keep up the great job steve overlay of
sin city smokers barbecue and catering!
p.s. 
exactly what you would expect from the president of the nvbbqa & a kcbs award winning competition team & certified bbq judge!

Sorry Rollin Smoke and Big B's there's some new BBQ in town!!! 
What y'all know about pulled pork and Mac n cheese on a sandwich.....Sin City Smokers knows!!!!
Along with the brisket and baby backs and greens and baked beans I think we had more food than that but I'm in a food coma!!!
We drove from Mnt Edge to try this place and I'm glad we did!!!
Looks like I'm gonna have to make the drive to Green Valley more often because here is definitely more food I want to try here!!! 
Wonderful!!!

The food is ok. I think the Ribs are really not that food and i dont understand why they come with a raw onion and a big pepper for, makes no sense to me. My favorite thing there is the corn bread with honey butter. I throw it in the toaster oven when i get home for a few minutes.
Love this place. Best BBQ I've had in years. Had the Big Daddy mac & cheese Thursday,sooo good.the Brisket is smokey & juicy. Looking forward to trying the tues. spec. Tamales.

I came here with my boyfriend last night for dinner and it was delicious! The person who took our order was very helpful. I had the grilled cheese stuffed with their pork and mac and cheese and my boyfriend had a half pound of pork with fries. Everything was seasoned well and came out quickly. We shared cornbread and honey butter as well, which was a nice, sweet side to go with the great house spicy bbq sauce. The portions were just right for the price. We will definitely come back in the future!

Wow!!  Hooked me up again. Steve and his team can come up with some crazy creative ideas. I know BBQ is his forte but his team is well rounded in all culinary wishes.  A man that mentored me for years retired today and sin city came through with a unbelievable spread. Makes me look good to my customer consistently. Not sure how he's going to top today's performance.

This is probably the best BBQ place in town! I'm a fan of the Brisket and the Mac and Cheese! Customer service top notch! I highly suggest you check out this place. It's kind of hidden but it's a gem! The sauces are amazing as well. I love BBQ and this place always hits the spot!

Order of the brisket sandwich with a couple sides cost me $14 which is kind of pricey 

The pros 

Nice flavor on the brisket at the sauce good quality nicely done, not the best brisket I've ever had but above avg

The mac & cheese was all right slightly above average

The baked beans were actually the highlight of the meal might be some of the tastiest beans I can remember I've had

The cons the size of the sides really a miniature cups for two dollars each I would rather spend 2.50 to 3 dollars a side and get just a little bit more than they give, especially considering how good those beans are

They do offer what they call a plate version but I did my find another way to combine meats like most other of the barbecue places do, seems to me that they could do some work on the menu such as offering a two or a three meat combo maybe I missed it but the menu still seems to be needing a little bit more development

The staff is friendly which is a plus

This is very close to being 4stars....sure I'll give it another go and if it's good it will get bumped up there's just so many bbq places and the sides value and the ability to get more than just one meats are things that can be improved

Incredible value for the money in my books. The beef brisket is so tender and flavourful - wife doesn't like beef much and she enjoyed it very much. Ribs are very tender - we had a tougher pork side rib end but even the meat on these fell off with minimal effort. Chicken was tender but a little spicy for my wife. The sides were good - albeit a little small - I would have doubled my $2 order per side had I known.   Desserts were interesting - though not spectacular. Ate in once and took out another time. I'll be back.

Sin City smokers has some of the Beef Brisket I've ever had. I also a side of Mac N Cheese which was amazing. The Brisket is smoked perfectly and seasoned just right. Also tried two different sauces both of which are good. One was spicy and the other was sweet. Either one is a good pick.  The staff was extremely polite, and the restaurant was clean. I will defiantly be returning back to try other menu items.

I'm originally from Memphis and have had my fair share of great barbecue. In fact, I usually bring back pulled pork and sauce when I visit. Living in Las Vegas, I've always said I have yet to find barbecue that compares to true Southern barbecue, until now.

Sin City is AMAZING! Without a doubt, this is the best barbecue in Vegas. All the sides are great, too. I'm also a stickler for service and whether placing an order over the phone or dining in, the staff is great!

Absolutely amazing! We ordered this catering for our wedding reception and it was all the rage!! Their macaroni and cheese was to die for and the brisket was insanely good!! It was definitely the hit of the event and I'm not even mad about it!

We had Sun City cater our company team event at Axe Monkeys and the food was spectacular!  Everything was fresh and delish. I was impressed with the catering crew as well. They were super friendly and met all of our needs. I definitely recommend them for your next event.  Their menu choices made it easy to choose what to serve.  No hidden  or extra fees for things.  It sure made planning the event easy for me.  Loved the food, loved the service and now hubby and I want to check out their restaurant.  Highly Recommend!!!!!
Decent prices and a great BBQ place. Items on the menu are small portions so if you are hungry please feel free to order more food.

Fantastic food!!! I am a big fan of" kitchen sink or junk yard fries" and their Bad ass fries are some of the best ive ever had!!! So flavorful and filling!!! Had the brisket with them and holy cow they are to die for!!! We have also tried the sandwiches, smoked chicken wings and big daddy Mac and cheese.... all were amazing!!! They have a great,  friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming  staff!!! When we went in for the second time one of the girls remembered us and our order from last time and made us feel like home!!! Great place for a great environment nice staff and incredible BBQ!!!

The best BBQ I have had in Vegas!!!
You have to try this little hidden gem
 Two thumbs up!!!!!

Sin City Smokers has some great smoked BBQ, employees that treat you like family and Steve went above and beyond to make sure our meal was done right! I had the Big Texas Salad and my hubby had the ribs with yummy Cole slaw and to die for BBQ sauce. We will definately be back! Thank you for going the extra mile for making our food and dining experience very enjoyable!

Had my first experience with Sin City Smokers today. The food was outstanding...especially the brisket and the mac & cheese. Also had the chicken which was moist and tasty. My friend enjoyed the ribs and baked beans too.  My only complaint is the portion sizes.  The brisket needed at least one more slice and the sides are too small. The place isn't cheap they need to provide at bit more food. I'll still go back many times.

Outstanding!

BBQ doesn't get any better than this!

Have been going since they opened...and it is over a 10 mile drive to do that.  worth every mile.

I still can't make it through the entire menu because I can't get past the brisket.  The best I have ever had...and I have had all over the country.

The ribs are great, I love the chicken, on Sundays they do a Brunswick Stew...great.  But mostly I still can't get past the brisket because you can't get anything like it anywhere else.  My wife likes the lean brisket, I like the fatty cut.  They do both better than anybody anywhere.

This guy understands meat!

After driving past it a few times I finally found Sin City smokers. It is a few blocks from where I work and I was excited to see a new place in the area, especially some BBQ. I entered the place and went to the front to look at the menu on the wall. I saw what I wanted and waited by the register for a few minutes until someone came out from the back. They were kind enough to explain some of the options on the menu and I placed my order. 

I went with the Brisket ( a 1/4 lb) and it came with raw onions and a pepper. I really just wanted meat, raw onions are not appetizing to me  but the grilled pepper had some nice flavors. I also had a 1/2 rack of ribs. The ribs were decent, nothing out of this world or something I would go back for. The brisket was dry and I was thankful they put sauce in my bag so it was more edible. It did have a nice outer crust and smoke ring, just not juicy as I have had it elsewhere. Looking at the different sides I went with the mac and cheese, they call it another name but that's what it was. It was a super small portion, a few bites and there is a cheese it on top. I see all the trophies when walking in and I hope they do well here but I would not be a return customer.

Fantastic food with exploding finger licking taste. I highly recommend this place if you want good BBQ. Award winning with all the trophies being displayed. I ordered the Big Daddy platter- 2 sides of brisket and chicken platter. Highly recommend the brisket. I love  the Jalapeño potato  salad and cornbread. A place you must check out.
Had at a friend's wedding reception and it was so delicious.  My husband still talks about it and how we need to eat more. One guest went back 5 times just for the brisket.

We had Steve and Shirley cater a a funeral/celebration of life for my husbands brother who was unexpectedly killed. They did such a great job I can never thank them enough for taking a huge stress off us and serving the best barbecue I have personally ever had. If you ever want great barbecue and excellent service this is where you want to go!!! 

Debbie Davila

Okay so this is about a month late so shame on me.

This place is good. Like really good. I happened to find it because of heading to a golf course and thought I'd give it a try.  I was recommended the brisket melt and it did not disappoint.  I would highly suggest this to anyone going to give that sandwich a go.  It had great flavor and just the right amount of moisture within the brisket.  The bread had a nice crisp crunch that you would expect from a proper melt.  

I would totally make every attempt to come back and eat here whenever I'm back in Vegas.  A bit off the strip however it's exactly what I was looking for which would make it more of something the locals would eat.

Best brisket and fish we've had since moving to Las Vegas over 8 1/2 years ago. We've tried a lot of BBQ restaurants and this place is by far the best. We're from Southeast Texas so we know BBQ well. Their BBQ tamale Tuesday special is also delicious. Big portions and great prices. It's also extremely clean and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend Sin City Smokers. Go check this place out. You will not be disappointed.

I have been meaning to write a review about this place. We've taken out BBQ three times from here and LOVE everything we've ordered. The brisket is the best in the west!!! The chicken is YUMMY.  Ribs are out of this world! Steve makes a KILLER DILL COLESLAW and a RICH MAC N CHEESE I'd eat every day if I wasn't trying to lose my prego weight! Come to think of it, I wish I had discovered this place when I was pregnant!!!

If I could give them 6 stars I would.  The food is phenomenal and well worth the price.  All the meats are tender and juicy.  The sauce and rubs they use are flavorful and not too salty.  The service is awesome and everyone who works there is extremely helpful.  If you want BBQ, GO HERE!

OH MY GOD!!!! Just tried this place for the first time... The food is AMAZING!!! My hubby was born and raised in Texas and always brags about real "Texas BBQ"... He bragged about Rudy's in Texas and how nothing ever comes close to it. Well... I'm here to tell ya.... this place far exceeds Rudy's Texas BBQ!!! I ordered the "Porkstar" BBQ Pork AND Mac N Cheese on Texas Toast.... I am in a total food coma right now! The Maple Bacon BBQ Baked Beans are phenomenal!!
