My 9 year old daughter ordered the B.S.L.T (Bacon steak, Lettuce and Tomato on Texas Toast. If you think bacon is life then this is the sandwich for you! My hubby got the Tater Nachos.... holy crap! They have everything on them!!! Sweet Potato Fries with Honey Badger Sauce.... soooo good!!! And their BBQ Sauce.... Sweet or Spicy? I couldn't decide so I had both! LOL
HUGE portions, great prices and oh the desserts!!!! I cannot wait to go back on Wednesday for the Baked Potato Special!
This is our new favorite BBQ spot! (And we don't have to drive 1800 miles to get there!)

My friends visited me from LA last weekend. They said they wanted bbq and found this place on Yelp. It is right down the street from me and I was surprised that I didn't know about it. Best bbq I've ever had. We ordered pork ribs, brisket, pulled pork, dill slaw, beans and corn bread. So good, not a day goes by that I don't think about it. My buddy Dennis asked me what I thought tasted best. All I could tell him was, its all good! I couldn't decide....everything was equally delicious including the sides. Truly unbelievable. Trying to go back for more this weekend. You have to try this place out! 6 stars

6$ for canned beer no fountain drinks only bottled water for 2$ no kids menu brisket sandwiches looked liked huge slabs of fat and the sides portions are tiny...This place is way overpriced and not even close in comparison to rollin smoke bbq... don't waste your time or money you'll be disappointed.

The best barbecue that I've had in Henderson. Nice little restaurant. The sides dont have as much "soul" (hint hint wink wink) as is my preference but good enough. I don't recommend the mac and cheese. Idea is better than the execution. It's essentially kraft plus chez-Its. My only real complaint. 
     Ive liked: BSLT, Brisket (was as close to being in Texas that I've had), Texas Melt and baked beans. ..good lemonade  (not too sweet). 
     Friendly service. Really clean. Food fast considering the quality.

This place is AMAZING!!  Great BBQ and the staff is always friendly. I absolutely LOVE the baked beans!! (A must try)

Best BBQ in Las Vegas! Unreal taste and amazing atmosphere. Cleanliness was off the chart as well. Customer service 10 star. So disappointed that we found this place on our last day here. BLESS YOURSELF WITH THIS FOOD!
Favorite bbq in Vegas! Portions are huge. Friendly customer service and great atmosphere. I eat here as much as possible.  You will not regret it!
Hearty portions with great barbecue.  Authentic taste with great smokey flavors.  Food was so plentiful that two entrees was plenty for 4. This bbq was wonderful!

BEST BBQ EVER! SOOO happy that the restaurant portion is finally open! My family and friends and I have used them multiple times for catering, after finding them at a bbq competition (which they always do AMAZING at), and we have NEVER been disappointed! ALWAYS an awesome staff, great food, and the owners are really cool too! 

GREAT prices, especially considering the awesome quality you get! sides are made from scratch, the sauces are ALL their own, and OMG.... i really can't put into words how great everything is! 

personally, I'm working on trying everything on the menu, so far, so good!

Great BBQ spot.!!!! The inside has a great and fun southern bbq kinda place atmosphere.  Probably one of the BEST pulled pork and bbq brisket I've ever had.  Cooked oh so tender with a fabulous Smokey flavor! 
Good portion size for me but my hubby could have had a larger portion.... on the sides that is! 
Will be back!

We have been craving bbq, so tried it today. Restaurant is very clean and cool decor. I got the brisket and husb got the hot links. Brisket was very tender, but full of fat and almost inedible. Mac and cheese was ok. Husband's hot links were maybe 5 pieces of meat and onions and peppers. He said was good, but not very much meat for price. Overall, mehhh, we won't be back.

It's everything you want and need in a Bbq smokehouse!!!! Thank you someone doing it right for a change. If they'd add add some sweet candied yams, the side choices would be for me complete! I tried all the smoked meats everything tasted delicious and very flavorful. When you want some great Bbq look for this establishment!! I can't wait till I return!!!
Great Q at legit prices. Ppl there are as nice as can be. The food will blow u away. Its my go to spot

Hands down the best BBQ joint in Vegas. Ribs are tender with good smoke (maybe add a little), flavorful sauce without being too sweet. Overall excellent meat, Pitmaster is doing a fine job. Baked beans are totally awesome, literally the best beans I've had in years...just perfect. Slaw is excellent and I don't even like Dill Slaw...but I do now! This slaw is perfect! Sin City Smokers can compete on a national level with Q from across the country and be proud! This is a first for Vegas (Henderson). You will not be disappointed by trying their meats! 100% recommended.

Once you walk into this place there are many trophies from different BBQ competitions, so right away I knew it was going to be a quality meal...i wasn't wrong. I didn't want to spend a whole lot so I went for the $8.99 loaded baked potato with brisket. (You can choose whichever meat you'd like) They bring out this massive potato piled high with brisket cheese sour cream BBQ sauce and chives. The brisket had the best smoky flavor on it and was tender not dry at all. I will definitely be back to try the baby backs and pulled pork. Very friendly staff. If you want some serious award winning BBQ take a trip to Henderson and treat yourself.

I highly recommend the Brisket, Texas Toast, 5 cheese mac, and their lemonade! It has to be the best Texas Toast I've ever had. The brisket is so juicy and flavorable. Lemonade isn't too sweet or sour and I Love It!

Sin City Smokers is Hot & New.  Actually, they're not new to Las Vegas.  Sin City Smokers is known around town as one of the best BBQ catering businesses in Las Vegas.  They're also known throughout the country and have placed 1st place for "Best Ribs" a ton of times.  Check out their trophy cage located inside their restaurant.  It's pretty impressive. 

I heard rumors over a year ago that Sin City Smokers was planning on opening a restaurant in Las Vegas.  And finally, they're here.  Sin City Smokers is known for their ribs, but it's the brisket that brought me here.  If they have good ribs, they must have a good brisket too.  Besides, I usually skip pork and not a huge ribs guy.  The menu isn't stacked like the rest of the BBQ restaurants in town.  Their meats consist of ribs, hot links, BBQ chicken, and brisket.  Pick your meat and then choose how you want it served.  I chose to have the brisket with their Texas toast.  I have to admit, the brisket is one of the best that I've had in Las Vegas.  The brisket was a combination of fatty and lean, which is just how I like it. It was also tender and had that smoked flavor to it.  It's a good thing that the brisket was good because the Texas toast was a little dry.  The brisket was so good that I ended up eating it by itself with no sauces.  If I had an issue with their brisket, it's the portion size.  I got about 6 oz. of brisket for $9.99.  Additional sides are $2 and I got their Maple Bacon Baked Beans.  This was pretty good.  I just thought it was a little small (less than a cup) for the price.  

Overall, I have mixed feelings about Sin City Smokers.  Las Vegas has a lot of BBQ restaurants in town, especially in Henderson.  For the price I paid, I'm used to getting about 8 oz. of meat, sometimes two different types, and two sides.  Also keep in mind that they don't hook it up here.  The menu is also missing beef ribs, tri-tip, burnt ends, turkey, etc.  I'm not saying they don't have it or can't make it.  It's just not on their menu.  The sides for $2 each are on the smaller side too.  But then again, I didn't get what they're known for and that's their ribs.  The reason for the 4 star review is because their brisket is so good and worth coming back for. I just wish the portions, including their sides, are a little bigger.  

TIP #1: Located off Green Valley and Sunset, where Sumo Sushi used to be located. 
TIP #2: Check out their Weekly Specials.  
TIP #3: Signature Sandwiches also on the menu (3 pork sandwiches / 1 beef sandwich)
The food is incredible and that may be an understatement. Meat was tender and extremely lean.

I consider myself a barbecue prude and this place is absolutely fantastic. you gotta try the porkstar it's ridiculous. Had the Texas melt with brisket and it was just as good. Staff was really friendly also. These folks are really on to something here. I'll be back for sure.. ALOT.
This place is GREAT!! I love the daily speicals!! Today I had the giant baked potato with brisket! Best BBQ in town!!
Had a fantastic meal here at the suggestion of a friend.  All of the meats and sauces that we tried were very good as were the sauces.  Will definitely come back when I am in Vegas again.
Took son to lunch and had to try out the new restaurant.  Very good food. Service was wonderful. Has a real barbecue smell when you walk in.

I'm a BBQ fanatic. Tried a few places in Vegas and this by far is ....MMmmm THE BEST I EVER HAD. Try the #porkstar sandwich if you know what's good for ya! 
Grilled cheese on Texas toast, already yum, now add pulled pork....and a fatty helping of mac N cheese., ladies and gentleman you have the PORKSTAR. Amazing. 
-cornbread needs a little love*

Great bbq! brisket was the best i have ever had . The mac and cheese was creamy , cheesee, with a little crunch on top, sweet beans were like candy just the way they should be. Golden nuggets were tasty and and fried pb&j top me off for a great dessert. The staf was freindly and helpful . We will be returning alot.

A nice addition to the Henderson BBQ scene that seems to be growing by the day. My husband loves meat and wanted to try this spot as soon as he discovered it. It seemed like good fuel before our axe throwing league night. 

Sin City Smokers Barbeque is located in an older shopping center at Sunset and Green Valley. It's not the nicest looking shopping center so I was pleasantly surprised when we stepped inside the restaurant. The restaurant is very clean and uncluttered. The Texas BBQ themed décor was cute and added to the ambiance. The counter is in the middle of the restaurant where orders are taken and then brought to the table. The entrance divides two sections of seating. The inside of the restaurant is well done for a casual dining spot. The restaurant smells amazing as soon as you walk in the door too.

The menu offers several meats and from there you choose if you want the meat in tacos, a salad, plated, as a sandwich, in a quesadilla, or on fries. There are about half a dozen side options that come a la carte. In addition there are several specialty sandwich options and daily specials. The menu doesn't look big, but there are a actually a lot of options.

My husband and I decided to share a few things. Unfortunately, they were out of ribs so we had to go with another meat. We chose Brisket and Smoked Pork. The brisket was marbled and didn't have a lean option. I really liked the flavor of it and when only eating half of the portion the amount of fat was fine. It would have been too rich for me to eat alone. The smoked pork was delicious and moist. I liked the traditional sauce that came with the meats. It had a little heat and a smoky flavor. The sweeter sauce was good, but I preferred the traditional sauce. 

For sides we shared Maple Bacon Sweet Baked Beans and Jalapeno Potato Salad. We both loved the baked beans and they were sweet indeed. I love that they didn't hold back on the maple flavor. The potato salad was good and the jalapeno didn't overwhelm the flavor or add too much heat. The only disappointment was the Sweet Tea. My husband declared it garbage and upon tasting I asked if he had grabbed from the wrong drink dispenser. Hopefully it was just a bad batch and it'll be better next time.

The pricing seemed about right in comparison to other BBQ spots in the area. Most places offer a plate that comes with sides, but even with the a la carte ordering it didn't add up to more than other restaurants charge for a combination plate. It'd be cool if the plated option that comes with onions and a jalapeno included a small piece of cornbread or even a slice of white bread (traditional to Texas BBQ style).

The portions aren't as large as some other spots, but I kind of liked that it was easy to enjoy BBQ without overdoing it. With my husband and I sharing two meats and two sides I'd say that our meal was on the lighter side. Each side made a small serving for each of us. 

We'll be back. Hopefully the ribs will be available next time!

Good food. The BLT and the pulled pork were excellent. The potato salad was great and the  slaw but I preferred the potato salad.

My only complaint is I wish the sides were bigger and that you got extra of the roasted jalapenos with the food

Best barbecue I've ever had!  The staff are super friendly and helpful.  Prices are really good too.  We wanted everything so we got the brisket, spare ribs and spicy Italian sandwich..soo full but totally worth it.  We shared the sandwich and a couple desserts with our friend.  It's awesome this place is just up the street from our house..we will definitely be back!!  Thanks for the delicious food!

This place is AWESOME if you want some good authentic BBQ. We came here on the way from Vegas to Sam Boyd. Service was fantastic and the food.....I LOVED IT. My kids (5 and 8) still talk about it. Good beer selection too.

The brisket was cooked perfectly. It pulled away as a great brisket should.
 
The Spare ribs pulled away from the bone nicely. 
The Texas red sauce was AMAZING!.

I'd skip the Smack-a-Roni next time though. The Smack-a-roni was not something I will order again. The only real flavor came from the crushed Cheezits topping it. 

The shoestring fries must be the Texas version be cause they were regular fries. 
They were really good though with that season salt though.

I look forward to coming back for sure.

They catered my nieces UNLV graduation and did a phenomenal job.  Very professional staff and service from beginning to end.  The food was incredible!!!!! Had a carving station for the brisket which was perfection that melted in your mouth.  I would definitely use them again or simply dine in the restaurant on a regular basis!! John

Well, I finally found my favorite BBQ in Vegas. I love you Rolling smoke. You guys will always have a special place in my heart but brisket is my true love and Sin City does it the best. They cut me the point, just the way I like it. The perfect fat/meat cut! The sides are perfect size so I can try a variety of them. I went by myself and got everything I wanted for only $20 bucks. Well done on the price point guys! The service was awesome as well! The energy the 2 girls in the front put out make the place an even better experience. The owner is always there from the sound of it and after speaking with him about his passion it just made for a perfect meal.  I'm stuffed!!!
Yummy  Awesome brisket all BBQ is amazing

This place has been right under my nose for awhile and I didn't know about it! Thank goodness it was ROTD a couple weeks ago. It's just across the street from the Trader Joe's a shop at a few times a week! Hubby was at home with the kiddo and I said I'd bring home lunch. He was up for anything and I was craving BBQ, as always. I got some loaded fries for myself, tacos for him, some ribs and a free side thanks to my Yelp check-in. 

The way the menu is set up is pretty cool. They list all their meats, which you can get as a sandwich. And next to that are other ways to get them - as loaded fries, as tacos, etc. every day of the week is a different special - I remember one day is tamales. You can also buy meat by the pound, do a combo plate and pick out sides and desserts. 

I was completely in love with my loaded fries! The fries themselves were done well. And then they were topped with cheese, baked beans, corn salsa and choice of meat - I went with brisket. There were HUGE chunks of tender brisket all over these fries! The meat was so good that it could definitely stand on its own. The corn salsa and baked beans were great additions, too! I'm not usually a fan of beans, but these had so much flavor and were so sweet that I couldn't get enough!

The taco plate comes with two tacos. Hubby had one Pulled pork and one chicken and said he enjoyed both. Part of me wishes I'd gotten to try them myself, but I was happily stuffing those fries in my face...

The Ribs were some of the best I've found here in Vegas. They probably come in second. They had quite a chewy and flavorful bark and the meat was tender enough to pull off the bone. 

For my side I chose the dill slaw. It was decent, but nothing compared to my love affair with everything else. And it certainly had a strong dill flavor. 

The desserts I'm in the fridge looked good and I might have to try one next time. I can't wait until then!
Stopped in for a quick bite, the food was amazing.  We got the Big daddy plate which fed 3 of us. The food was tender,  the sides were excellent. Especially the mac n cheese. Yummy.

Best BBQ in town. Brisket and Babybacks on point!  

Try the Bad Ass Fries. (Yes, that's what they're called)

Definitely earned their reputation, ratings and awards. 

I think may be able to skip my next 4-5 meals.
Truly exceptional bbq. Best I have had out west. The pulled pork was especially great moist and tender. The brisket was great also and the Mac and cheese excellent as well. Love the vib also.
Delicious burnt ends. Juicy brisket. No frills presentation. Friendly, sincere staff :)

Yummy!!! This is the place to go for barbecue!!! Put all the others to shame!!! Meat falls off the bone, so tender and juicy!! Their sauces are all homemade and mouth watering!!  My husband may want to bottle it up for me to use as perfume!! LOL!!  Don't forget their sides baked beans with bacon and other secret ingredients , home made down south Mac n cheese will make you slap your mama!!! I also loved the tangy dill coleslaw!! They also give you some Texas toast to sap it all up!!!

Amazing!!! Best BBQ I have ever had! The Texas melt sandwich is pure heaven the brisket melts in your mouth like butter! And the service is outstanding! The girls they hired are super sweet and helpful greatly appreciated thank you! I highly recommend this place if I could give more than 5 stars I would!

We had a last minute catering event and they were able to accommodate and get us on the schedule. We weren't sure what we wanted and they were very helpful in helping us make a decision. The day of our event they were early and ready to go before even we were. The food was delicious and everyone there loved it.

I used Sin City Smokers for events ranging from community service for our fraternity, UNLV rebel tailgates, and even an event to showcase the UNLV campus to Administration and students from Singapore. Every person at every event loved the food and the atmosphere that the set up created. The staff and management were always there to answer any questions and the set-up and execution of the event was on fantastic, never had any worries, they were spot on. I would recommend Sin CIty Smokers for there professionalism and consistency and competitive prices. I now manage a Catering Company (Plaza Catering) in KC and Denver and can say that Sin CIty Smokers was and is a good one.

This is an average bbq joint. The burger is cooked fresh with basic toppings. The Mac and cheese was a pasteurized cheese food paradise of which I could only stomach one bite. The pulled pork and other meats were on the chewy side. 
I loved the service, spicy sauce and drink selections!

This place is amazing and Steve the owner is a great guy.  The food is so amazing that I am bringing Sin City Smokers over to the radio station I work at to cater our staff lunch.  BONUS is that this is a family owned business and they have alot of family recipes on the menu.  I was so impressed with the food the service everything was top notch.  They start fresh everyday with the best quality meat around.  I will def go back.

Thanks,
Kristine

On our last Las Vegas trip we arrived at around at 7PM for the purpose of taking advantage of the ongoing $15.99 full rack of baby back ribs special only to discover it had been sold out. This trip we called ahead to reserve only to discover it was unnecessary because there were still 4 left.  Oh well, better to be safe than eat at McDonalds.  I was surprised to find the restaurant entirely empty throughout our stay, perhaps everyone was out shopping?  We were told at the counter of a Black Friday special which included not only the ribs, but one side and a soft drink.  We chose the jalapeno potato salad which was pretty good and added dillslaw which was bland.  The ribs unfortunately were slightly overcooked and served wet much to my chagrin.  Overall, a decent deal.

My husband and I visited this place for the first time after reviewing the menu at home. I was hopeful to have some good BBQ. I ordered the featured item, burnt ends. My husband ordered the Porkstar sandwich. I took one bite of my food and it was one bite too many! My husband took two bites of his sandwich and felt the same. The meat of both meals tasted boiled to the point of mush. The sauce was tasty but couldn't hide the horrible taste and texture of the poorly prepared meat. The only saving grace for more than $20 wasted was that a homeless person ate poorly today, but they ate.

Steve and the Sin City Smokers crew are everything you could ever want in a caterer.  I recently hosted a corporate party for upwards of 500 people at a private residence in the outskirts of Vegas.  Steve was consistently detail-oriented and professional from our first introductory phone call.  He holds a lot of pride in his business (as he should -- the food is INCREDIBLE) and it's evident through his courteous professionalism and passion for his craft. 

Now, onto the food.... he makes the absolute best brisket I have ever had.  Actually, I'm pretty sure it's the best meat I've ever eaten -- period.  Melt-in-your-mouth goodness with an incredible array of sides perfect for our audience.  We had:  "smackeroni and cheese", mashed potatoes, biscuits with honey butter, three different meat options (brisket, ribs and chicken) and salad.  Each and every item was standout delicious in its own right, but perfectly complemented one another on a (heaping!) plate.  

They were on time, set up and tore down quickly, and were friendly and informative for our guests.  I'd give them six stars if I could, and won't go anywhere else when I need a caterer in Vegas.

A MUST TRY!

Placing an order for an office of 20, day of is tough enough but they helped me out and it was delicious!!!! The 5 cheese Mac and cheese was amazing!!! I can't wait to try the ribs, definitely going back!

Came here with my two kids, got the brisket sandwich and I Got the Brisket plate. brisket was more then tender and had a nice smoke ring. The portions were perfect. The shoestring fries were not thin like you'd assume they'd be, they were almost thick cut but they were still ok. The bbq sauces here are also pretty good, I recommend this place. The music was disproportionately loud also.

I am a vegetarian and usually going to a barbecue place there's not a whole lot of fun for me. This place was smoking! I got a vegetable plate that filled me up and was reasonably priced, the french fries were yummy, the barbecue sauce was delicious and the mac and cheese was stellar. I'm about ready to go get dessert may I add to my review in a little bit but would totally recommend it. The people I am with are not vegetarians and said the meat was the best  mosr tender brisket that they'd ever had with which is saying a lot because we had a lot of places. We'll be back!

Eve had brisket so good you didn't even want BBQ sauce on it? I did yesterday at Sin City!!! Brisket was incredible and we had amazing sides. Best Mac and Cheese accompanied by REALLY good baked beans. Their menu offers lots of options - my husband had a brisket quesadilla! Never heard of anything like that until yesterday and it did not disappoint. Great atmosphere and if you wonder how good it is just check out all of the trophy's as you walk in
Customer service was excellent.  Our server gave us the option the option between the lean, dry end of the brisket and the fatty, wet end. We went for the lean and it was delicious.

I'll start with the good because I love to see small businesses succeed, and just because it wasn't my cup of tea doesn't mean you won't love it.

The aroma is out of this world, wafting into the parking lot, it hits your nose like a ton of bricks, in the most delicious way possible.

The atmosphere is very comfortable especially for a bbq joint.  Casual sit-down. Nice decor. 

The service is very friendly! I ordered online via yelp and the blonde who greeted me when I picked it up was vert nice and even let me use the yelp check-in to add a free small side to my already-completed order! 

They got the order correct and accomodated all my requests (cut sammich in half, sauce on the side, etc)

Brisket was tender.

The bbq sauce itself is delicious!  I really like the sweet bbq!  They put a bunch of dif flavors in the bag so I could sample them all! That really made me happy!

Now to what I didn't like.  Again, keep in mind that everyones tastes are different.  I am simply writing my personal take on the food.

Food was very greasy. I understand bbq isn't exactly health food.  And I am by no means a health nut.  But when the flavor and mouthfeel of grease is what stands out in a dish, it takes away from the experience. 

The food was missing that "wow" factor.  I can't place my finger on it but it just didn't "hit the spot" for me. I ate the food, but I found myself wishing I'd gotten something else.

 Maybe other items of theirs are more up my alley.

Give it a try for yourself! I hope you love it.
The BBQ chicken and Veggie mix tacos were delicious! Super friendly staff, we will be back!

Amazing BBQ , super nice Decor probably the best in Las Vegas that's for sure, 
Would highly recommend , definitely worth the trip !!

Great bbq at great prices! 

They keep it's simple with their 6 meats to choose from and you build from there to make any thing from tacos/quesadillas to the Bad Ass fries which are a favorite of mine! Everyone should have them on their must try list when visiting this establishment. I like to add the smoked pork to my bad ass fries. 
I have also tried the bbq chicken on a sandwich, DELICIOUS. 
They also offer daily specials. I happened to go on a Sunday when the special was the Brunswick stew, DELICIOUS! Very filling and stick to your ribs good. 
The fries are in a league of their own. Very well seasoned and addicting, I couldn't stop myself.
The way the meats/meals are served is traditional of how bbq is served in many parts of the country (over raw white onion with a grilled jalapeño) If you don't like it simply ask for your dish plain. 
Anyway I'll definitely be back for some more delicious bbq, looking forward to trying more of the daily specials which I've heard are (ALL) great!

I am not sure what this place is doing in a downtrodden strip mall, but all i can say is ONE word.... Beef Brisket!

I normally dread going to a BBQ restaurant as it is really 50/50 with the quality of the brisket. I would say most of the places, it is very dry.

The services is great, you walk in, you tell them what you want, pay for it and sit and wait.  

The decor is not bad, the seating is okay, but the service and food are excellent.  They have beer and wine as well.

GK says, pork out here on the beef brisket. You will find the melt in your mouth flavors are wonderful.

Check it out.
Very fatty large ribs. Over priced. The bean side could fit in a thimble. The banana pudding was as thick as wall paper paste. Do yourself a favor and find a better BBQ joint.

Delicious food! And their costumer service was amazing! Beautiful restaurant too! 

This place is totally a meat eater spot but does have a nice creative menu for people who dont eat meat which I thought was neat! Really appreciated that!

The brisket was on point.  They key to the sandwich was to add the tangy sauce and horseradish slaw.
The ribs were not on par with the brisket.  They were chewy and only "one note" of flavor coming through.  They were served cold and the sauce on top tastes slightly raw. Thy needed more smoke or caramelization to really make them stand out. The sides are small but well prepared.  The fried were over salted but tasty.

Not bad for a mid morning lunch during the week.

This place would easily be a 4-5 star BBQ joint if it wasn't for the sides. They tasted alright but the portions were just stupid.

They basically force you to upgrade to the larger sizes and extract more money. Okay, I get it. So, we ordered the largest coleslaw available and it wasn't even filled to the top.

C'mon, it's just cabbage with watered down mayo and some seasoning. If you make me pay extra, at least fill it to the top. The other sides weren't any better in that regard.

Also, skip the sandwiches. There's a lot of lonely bread; the meat was really skimpy for the price. Basically, a ripoff.

That was the problem. The food was good, staff friendly, atmosphere fun, but we felt like we got ripped off in some way.

I had the pulled pork tacos & HOLY MOLY they were amazing.   The meat & toppings were paired perfectly.  Other people at my table got the brisket plate, the spicy sausage plate & the special (ribs & wings).  Every single person went on & on about how amazing their food was.  We also had mac & cheese for a side.  It was topped with cheez its & also SOOO GOOD.  Highly recommend this place.  From the cleanliness, to the amazing customer service & the delicious food.  A+++ in all categories.

Great Southern BBQ the place is very cute and the service was really good.
Brisket is very moist and delicious.  The ribs are excellent.  Their sides are wonderful especially the potato salad and coleslaw.  Pulled pork is out of this world.
You should really give them a try!!!
Amazing food and wonderful people.. They catered a surprise birthday party.. Will definitely use them again!! Highly recommend them!!

Picked Sin City based on Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed!  Christie was responsive, friendly and helpful through the whole ordering process for catering (delivery) an event for my family.  Food was delivered on time. They brought plastic ware wrapped in napkins, plates, wipes and a plastic table cloth (which we didn't need). The ribs were amazing - the meat fell off the bone and it was not dry.  Extra BBQ and hot sauce provided.  The smoked BBQ beef was flavorful and tender.  The cornbread and biscuits - perfect, moist and delicious!  Everyone raved over the vinegar coleslaw. The salad was fresh, provided with ranch and Italian dressing.  Roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes - very good.  But the red beans with rice? Mouth watering. We were afraid the fruit trifle would be too sweet but it was not - every single dish was thoroughly enjoyed.  Thank you, Sin City!  We will definitely be eating here again the next time we are in Vegas!
Stopped in again for some lunch. Got the brisket as a sandwich. The BBQ sauce is on point!!! I've already got my eyes on what I want next time. Support local BBQ!
We used Sin City Smokers for our company bar b que picnic.  It was delicious.  They brought so much food  we got to eat sumptously twice.   Highly recommended.

To borrow a line from Tracy Morgan "I like this sandwich so much I want to take it behind a 7 eleven and get it pregnant" The Texas Melt Sandwich is a signature item at Sin City, order one and you'll see why.-Consummate perfection and delicious overkill in every bite. 

The Texas Melt consists of angus beef brisket (wonderfully tender, moist, and flavorful,but not soggy or overcooked), pepper jack cheese, roasted red peppers,Texas red sauce and grilled onions on buttery Texas toast, and tasty but not too hot picked peppers on the side-so incredibly good and so bad for you! 
 
The place has cool bbq headquarters feel to it and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. 

My only quibble is the 5 cheese Smack-a-Roni-mac n cheese, which nobody at our table liked. I'm pretty tolerant of processed cheese but it had a very yucky cheese wiz taste to it not the 5 cheese mac they're going for. I almost had the porkstar sandwich which is crammed with it. 

That aside the brisket was just awesome. It a cut that's so difficult to barbecue that it's a measuring yard of a good BBQ restaurant. Here in town I've had overcooked crumbly brisket and stiff as a board dry brisket (from the now closed Pot Liquor). This brisket is just perfection and I will be back!

This place smelled and tasted amazing 

I got the Texas Melt with some shoe string fries and it was mouthwatering delicious.
I have both dined in and done take out, and every experience with Sin City Smokers is awesome. Their BBQ is the best in the city and their brisket is AMAZING. I also love their Mac and cheese.

Had heard good things so decided to give it a try. We were impressed with the layout and atmosphere and menu choices. The meat is top notch as the brisket had a good bark and just right amount of smoke and rub. Pulled pork was moist and had a great flavor. All in all very good barbecue with average pricing for what you get.
Staff is very friendly and only issue is that the server had to cover the register as well which left a few plates like ours sitting a little longer in the pick up window then I would like.
Other then that it's a good choice for good bbq.

Wow , just wow !
Fast service and very reasonable prices.
I had the Brisket, it tender and delicious, 2 other  people  had the pork pastrami sandwich , they said it was great .
The employees are so nice and friendly in this relaxed atmosphere.
Location is so easy to find , at the corner of Sunset and Green Valley. Plenty of parking.
We will be back ......

The magazine in my hotel room has "Best Sandwiches" on the cover, so I had to look.  Found the Texas Melt mentioned and had to stop by with a side of baked beans.  It was absolutely amazing.  Recommend this highly as a sandwich connoisseur.  #sincitysmokers #texasmelt #vegasgoldenknights

To be fair we haven't eaten their food so this is no way a rating on that as I'm sure it's great! 
Highly disappointed with the way we've been treated. Planning a wedding from the uk was always going to be a little tricky however we thought we'd found the perfect food vendor and were absolutely delighted! 
After a month of emailing we thought the contract was finally ready to be signed after details being missed on the first two drafts being sent over...asked for the payment details and were massively let down being told the day has now been given to somebody else without even consulting us!
Now I understand that we hadn't signed anything yet but you feel like after putting all that time and effort it would be secured for you but maybe that's just me and not the way I'd run my business! We now have less than 4 months and it's a national holiday and places are already booked up..to start at square one. Such a shame that something as important as a wedding can be so easily pushed aside for another booking!

The brisket was good but not great.  They have sweet iced tea which is a must to go with BBQ.  The people working at the restaurant were all very pleasant and helpful.  I noticed a number of regulars come and go during my visit.  Most everyone ordered the ribs...I should have looked at the trophies that they have won for the best ribs.

My husband, friend and I came in last week to try this place out. We didn't know the place was here until the ad came across my Facebook feed. We have a BBQ place we like to go to in North Las Vegas. I'm glad to have found a place that is near us finally! I'm from Texas and I'm quite a snob about my barbecue!! The portions were amazing as well as the prices. While I'm trying to eat better these days it's unfortunate this place is so close to us!! Haha!  I tried the lemonade and sweet tea. That was my only hang up. I wish the tea was a little sweeter as well as the lemonade. I had the pork star and my husband and I shared the bad ass fries. Amazing!!! I'm so looking forward to coming back here again!

Quite impressed.  Everything was tasty.  All the meats were tender (we had ribs, brisket and pulled pork).  Love the mac 'n' cheese (cool original recipe), and the cole slaw was very tasty, not dry or bland.  Definitely will visit again when in Hendertucky.

Great atmosphere. Music a little loud. I think I'm turning into a prude. LOL. Pulled pork and the two  meat meal good portions for the money. The pickled jalapeños garnish would have been better if it had been and actual pickle. After I told her we found them on yelp she should've asked if I saw the free side dish coupon. Instead we were charged for it and it wasn't worth the trouble to do a refund.  . Apparently there is another barbecue place right down the street and I had pulled up their yelp page 1st and checked in. That's why I didn't see the coupon. LOL maybe next time I can use my coupon.
I live in Providence, but Sin City Smokers is worth the drive. Friendly staff and great Q!

I was at a work conference and Sin City Smokers was brought in to cater the event. We broke for lunch and walked outside where they were set up. The set up was awesome... I had the Mac N Cheese, Beans, Chopped Pork, Chicken and Brisket... and on the way in, I grabbed some banana pudding (Not a fan of banana pudding but it looked good so I figured I would hit it up). The food was absolutely fantastic. Once everyone got theirs, I came out and hit it up again. The food was up there with the best BBQ I've had. Their meats were smoky and moist. The sauces were terrific and the banana pudding was amazing. Couldn't of been happier with my meal. I will be stopping by on my own with the family for sure!

These guys are such pros, and believe me they did not let us down. From first contact all the way to service delivery, Christie looked after us and ensured that everything we asked for was adhered to on our wedding day. The brisket was insanely good, everyone at the reception commented on it - even a Las Vegas veteran who knows his stuff about eating out said it was the best brisket he'd tasted in town. That says a lot! The quality of food, service and value for money is impressive, I highly recommend these guys for any wedding reception or event function. They clean up pretty good to like they were never there. They will not let you down. Thanks again Christie! We appreciate all you did for us (and for the leftovers the following day, tasted EVEN BETTER, especially that macNcheese - oh my gosh...... I'm drooling typing about it!!!! Haha)

Now this was my first time and I got it to go, I'm willing to give them another try. 
Loved the restaurant, the decor, the 2nd amendment flags, the raw wood. Everything was clean. The girl that helped me was super helpful and friendly, give that girl a raise!
So the baby back ribs were good but not sure if it was because it was their Friday special, but the rib meat seemed scant on those bones. But they were tasty and I even liked the sauce, I am very picky with my sauce so I was pleasantly suprised. I tried some Mac and cheese with the cute cheese nip topping, it didn't do it for me, it was very bland, very plain. Then some cornbread, huge pieces, that tasted great but was terribly dry and crumbly.
I grabbed a cheesecake from their fridge before I left, I can't pass up dessert. Well, I wish I wouldn't have...you may like it but it was too "cheesy", not enough sweetness.
I'd get their meat again for sure, skip the rest.
This place Rocks. Best BBQ IN ALL OF VEGAS OR HENDERSON.very friendly, Delicious food. And a super Caterer. Try Sin City, you won't want to try any others.

Whoa. I was not expecting the food to be so freaking good. I usually don't go to BBQ spots because it is always a hit or miss but this place was a for sure hit!! 

When we pulled up in front the the restaurant we were pleasantly surprised by the awesome aroma coming from inside. The inside is super cute and I love the license plate lights! The girl at the front was super helpful since it was our first time. She suggested the big daddy plate I think it was called. It came with 5 meats and two sides. We decided to pay the extra $2 per side to get the bigger container. We also got three sweet teas and a chunky monkey desert. 

The BRISKET!!! Omg, it was tender and flavorful  the Mac and cheese was different with the cheez it's on top but it was good. The hot links were really good but I wish it was more on the tray. My aunt and daughter loved the ribs and baked beans the most. The baked beans were really good and if you like sweet baked beans then you will love it.

The chunky monkey dessert is AMAZING. I hope they do not stop making it. We only bought one for the three of us to try but we soon realized we will have to be back for more. 

This place is for SURE my new spot for BBQ !!!
One of the best BBQ places I have found it's not your cookie cutter joint. Great food lots of good flavor
Meh. Ordered takeout, waited quite a long time it seemed. They forgot one item. The smoked pork is not pulled or sliced, it's kind of chopped. Just meh.

Steve and his crew do an amazing job.  We booked them for our event with other food trucks, and their catering blew everyone else away.    The meatballs were delicious and savory, and the pulled pork sandwiches were just right.  Lots of people from our event commented on the food and asked me where I found them.  There on site catering set up looks great and captures the BBQ vibe perfectly.  Highly recommended!
The food was amazing I ordered the slab of pork ribs, mac n cheese, BBQ bean, BBQ chicken, and corn bread. The customer service was awesome such a nice place...

WOW, great experience they Young lady the waited on us last night rocked!! I will be going back again there are a few items on the list the really caught my attention. I had the brisket last night so tender!!

Best brisket in town, hands down. Not crazy expensive either and I've tried most barbeque places in town. You gotta try this place even their smoked turkey is amazing. Their sauce is on par too. And they have a good selection of drinks and and awesome atmosphere.

BEST. BBQ. IN. VEGAS!!!  This was our first time here, we've lived in Texas, Alabama, and Carolina.... so.... we know our BBQ and love it.  We've been looking for good BBQ in Vegas for almost 3 years, and this place is the best; hands down.  It could even give some places in the south a run for their money... check it out.

I ordered the PORKSTAR SANDWICH and it was EXTREMELY DELICIOUS. My husband also enjoyed it as well...the portions, the price points and service are PHENOMENAL!!!  As a native of Austin TX; Sin city BBQ can definitely give the entire state of aTX a "run for its money!" I am now a regular!!!!

I'm really hard on bbq joints, but I have no complaints about Sin City Smokers. It starts from the moment you walk in. The staff is exceptionally friendly and they take the time to explain the menu if you need help. This was my fourth time there, and the service and quality of food remains consistent. I've had the ribs before and they were very good. I thought they were a little pricey, but that is very common for ribs. On my last visit, I had the brisket.  It was very flavorful, tender, moist, and the serving size was perfect. For sides we had, Mac & cheese, beans, and potato salad. I enjoyed them all. I've read complaints from others about serving size of the sides, but I thought they were the perfect amounts. The fact that this place is close to my house makes it all the better. I'm a fan for sure.

This is by far the Best BBQ in Las Vegas!
Beautiful restaurant, great staff. Amazingly fantastic BBQ. Worth the drive,from any where in Vegas.

Came here with a friend for some lunch and I can definitely say I was not disappointed, got a 2 meat combo for $15.99 with one side. Also received a free side for checking in! I got the chopped pork and ribs and they were excellent! The chopped pork was smoky (but not too smoky) and full of flavor! The ribs were huge, juicy and tender! If you like good BBQ in a less crowded clean place I would definitely come here!! Great food and great portions! The staff is friendly the service was quick!! They played country music, but the food was so good I look past that (). I will be back no doubt!!

Very friendly staff. I went on a Friday so I got the full rack. Was a pretty solid rib. Good BBQ sauce as well. Nice atmosphere wasn't crowded when I went around 6 o'clock which wasn't a bad thing. Tea was pretty solid and had free refills. I honestly didn't care for the sides but it was still pretty good. I think it was the ribs that stole the show for me

Great news to have a new BBQ place within walking distance of my home. I loves me some 'cue!

Located at the intersection of Sunset and Green Valley Pkwy, in the NW corner shopping center. You walk in past all the trophies of owner Steve's competitive BBQ'g days up to the counter. Choice of meats, of how you want them (tacos, plate, sandwich, quesadilla, etc) and your sides ($2 each). They have a section of weekly specials and signature sandwiches as well.

I went with the 1/2 lb Brisket, with Maple Bacon sweet baked beans and 5 cheese Smack-A-Roni. All in, $20+. Sides are a bit small so recommend a double order. Brisket was nice and moist, with good flavor. The baked beans are almost the same recipe as my own, heavy on the maple and bacon flavor....delicious!!! Smack-a-Roni is good too, creamy with a couple cheez-its on top. 

Overall, the place is nicely decorated and clean. Service is good and friendly. Food is very tasty. I'll be back a lot I think, as I enjoy good BBQ. And I think they will get better as they work out all the kinks and get everything working perfectly. They only opened 5 days ago on 1/24, and sold out Friday night.

Hours are 10am-8pm 7 days a week. Not sure why but they have a catering page on Yelp as well with a few reviews, kind of confusing which page is which.

Hands-down no question the best brisket I've ever tasted in my life. I try and take everybody here that comes to town. The chef is a vegetarian and put out some of the best Q you'll ever taste in your life. The pricing is amazing the quality is doubly amazing and the flavor is off the chart.I drive 17 miles just to go there one way.
The food is excellent, service is great, side dishes are a little small, location is fantastic, prices a very reasonable.  My family loves this place.
I have been there may of times and keep going back. My favorite's are beef tamales on Tuesday and brisket Mac and cheese on Thursdays

This place is awesome!!! There are a couple really good bbq joints in town and alot that suck!! Havent had a bad thing yet here...and the brisket is the best I've had....love the way they cut it nice and thick!!!! Keep getting the 2 meat combo with brisket everytime and a different meat...been here 3 times and love it all so far!!
Great BBQ!   My wife and I both both got their specialty sandwiches.  Wow!  My only complaint is they don't have their liquor license yet, but that should be corrected soon according to the cashier.
Straight bbq no strings attached great staff and when a bbq place serves no leftovers sign me up tacos with brisket a 10 great beer selection as well

Sin City Smokers is a great place for anyone looking for some good, real barbecue. The space itself is charming and the staff is very friendly-happy to guide us through the menu. We had a pulled pork sandwich and bad ass fries with brisket. All delicious. The fries are amazing-and feed at least 2 if not 3 or 4. Layers of crispy fries, slightly smokey beans, slaw, cheese, and meat (these were just as good cold the next day). The iced tea, mint tea, and lemonade were delightful. My only issue was that the brisket was had a considerable layer of fat that was not pleasant.
